title: Software Engineer
description:
**Are you ready to make an impact? At Autocirc, we're on a mission to build Europe’s leading ecosystem enabling circularity for vehicles and promoting reuse of auto parts.** 




  





**We're now expanding our tech team and looking for passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment working on cutting-edge projects that matter.** 




  





 We’re looking for someone with hands-on experience in Azure, .NET, and ASP.NET Core, who is passionate about technology and eager to tackle challenges in a dynamic environment. We need someone who not only enjoys coding but also likes to understand business problems and can leverage technology to solve them.
 



  





 If you’re driven, love working with modern tech, and want to make a real impact by solving business challenges, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Tasks and responsibilities:** 



* Develop and maintain high-performing backend services.
* Implementation of synchronous and asynchronous integration patterns.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration.
* Drive innovation in system architecture and performance optimization.
* Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize system performance.
* Ensure code quality through testing, code reviews, and best practices.
* Continuously improve system scalability, security, and reliability.



  





 The role is located at our head office in Borås where most of the group functions are gathered and you work closely with colleagues in group IT as well as with local business stakeholders to deliver systems that solve their problems.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 To succeed, we believe that your background and skills include:
 


* You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or similar experience and more than five years of experience as a developer
* 4+ years of experience as a Software Engineer, preferably with .NET and ASP.NET Core.
* Experience working with Azure cloud services and deploying scalable applications.
* Proven ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
* Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and database management.
* Experience in optimizing system performance and ensuring high availability.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, version control, and DevOps practices.
* Interest or experience in frontend development is a plus (e.g., React, Angular, or similar frameworks).
* Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
* Fluent in English and good knowledge in Swedish.



  





 Autocirc is a young company with strong growth, we are therefore looking for flexible and dynamic people that are humble, service minded and focused on moving the company to the next level.
 



  





**About us** 




 Autocirc is a young organization dedicated to promoting a more circular approach in society. We offer you varied and challenging tasks in a modern, eventful and growing workplace. You will become part of our dynamic team at our state-of-the art office in the heart of Borås.
 



  





**Information and application** 




 Selection and interviews take place continuously, which is why we would like to receive your application as soon as possible. Please send the application to work@autocirc.com . State which role you are applying for in your application.
 



  





 For questions about the role, you’re welcome to contact Ludvig Hjalmarsson, CDO, at ludvig.hjalmarsson@autocirc.com.
 



  





***We look forward to hearing from you!***

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - EY Tech.Collective
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

 As a developer at the EY Tech Collective, you will create tax and law software products aimed at enhancing efficiency, quality, and user satisfaction. Our team assists thousands of clients with accurate and compliant tax filings and guides multinational companies through the complexities of international tax. To achieve high accuracy and efficiency, effective processes and robust software are essential. We operate across the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Sweden, Norway) within a small, flat, and informal organization of around 45 engineers, designers, researchers, and project managers. Our distributed setup allows team members to work from home or in offices based on personal preferences.
   

  

 While our focus is on tax filings and tax law, an interest in these areas is beneficial. Actual experience in tax is a plus but not a requirement, as the intersection of senior engineers with professional tax experience is quite small. We prioritize collaboration with well-rounded individuals who are both specialized and capable of working across disciplines.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As a senior frontend engineer, you will be responsible for developing elegant and responsive user interfaces for several critical products. You will write efficient JavaScript/TypeScript code for both React applications and Node.js server-side environments. Your code will be well-tested, documented, optimized for speed, and easy to maintain. You will have honed your skills through experience with complex applications in cross-functional teams, demonstrating strong collaboration abilities. If you are interested in expanding your skills across the stack, you may implement business logic in the backend and expose API endpoints.
   

  

 You will likely have participated in code reviews and have the confidence to question decisions made by senior colleagues, as well as challenge product decisions that seem illogical. If this resonates with you, we would love to connect.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with like-minded individuals to solve complex problems.
* Work closely with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers.
* Engage with users and researchers to gain a deep understanding of their challenges.
* Contribute across various products and problem spaces.
* Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from our offices in Copenhagen, Helsinki, Oslo, or Stockholm.


**Skills And Attributes For Success**
 We seek a skilled coder and a great colleague.
   

  

* A passion for software and a belief in its potential to help people.
* Proficiency in popular JavaScript frameworks like React and Node.js.
* Experience with mission-critical applications.
* A keen eye for aesthetics and UI quality.
* A positive attitude towards TypeScript and testing frameworks.
* Familiarity with service-based architectures and continuous deployment pipelines.
* Proximity to Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Stockholm, with remote work options available.
* Strong English communication skills, as it is our primary work language.
* An interest in tax law.


**What We Look For**
 We value more than just coding skills in a senior engineer.
   

  

* Craftspersons with attention to detail.
* Pleasant to work with.
* Clear communicators.
* Supportive and helpful.
* Quick problem solvers.
* Critical thinkers who question ideas before committing.
* Eager to learn.


**What We Offer You**
* A tech product team that operates in a user-driven manner within a large consultancy.
* Direct access to users for immediate feedback and input.
* A supportive environment with good food and enjoyable experiences.
* A diverse and inclusive culture that values your individuality and empowers you to help others find their voice.


 Deadline for application is 15 April 2025.
   

  

 At EY, we’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We’ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more
 *.*
 Apply today with your resume and optional cover letter. We review applications on a continuous basis so please apply right away.
   

  

 For questions regarding the role, do not hesitate to contact Brian.Groth@dk.ey.com. For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact helene.fife@dk.ey.com. We look forward to your application.
   

  

 To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Software Engineer (MySQL)
description:
We’re a global team working together to push the boundaries of open-source technology and multi-cloud solutions. Our vision is to become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone, leveraging the most popular open-source technologies like Aiven for MySQL®, Aiven for PostgreSQL®, Apache Kafka®, Aiven for Clickhouse®, and Aiven for OpenSearch®. to help companies accelerate time-to-market, drive efficiency, and build innovative solutions across any cloud. Right now, we’re looking for a
 **Software Engineer** 
 to join our team who shares our passion for forward-thinking and innovative approaches.
 



  





**About This Team** 




 At Aiven, we believe engineers can drive significant impact through coding and problem solving. Here, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to challenging projects that transcend any specific framework or cloud provider, work alongside exceptional engineers, and continuously expand your technical expertise. We strive to create an environment that encourages problem solving and results over following directions, so we make better decisions for our customers, our products and our employees.
 



  





**Who We Are** 




 So, how do we become the trusted open source data platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That’s why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we’re by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn’t just about who we are. It’s about who our customers are – and where they want to be.
 



  





**Our Crabby Principles** 




 Aiveners use the V2MOM framework to set and align on business goals. In order to achieve those business goals we live by our ‘Crabby Principles’ which unite us in our ways of working, globally.
 



  





 These principles are embedded in our business processes and support us in collaborating and role modelling positive and productive behaviours in our daily work, something you will have the opportunity to demonstrate throughout your interview journey with us.
 



  





**The Role:** 




 We are looking for a Software Engineer to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best data technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You’ll be part of the team that is focused on developing the relational database services and improving their scalability and reliability for our customers and OEM partners.
 



 Our philosophy is to deliver efficient and scalable solutions by continuously evolving and enhancing our product capabilities. Our own backend systems are mostly implemented in Python with bits of Java, Go and C.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 



* Write high-quality, maintainable code and release quality features.
* Participate in technical discussions and perform PR reviews.
* Contribute to technical planning and backlog management.
* Help investigate and resolve customer issues.
* Develop and improve the scalability and reliability of the data services powered by Aiven.



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
 



  





**Must Have:** 



* Excellent development skills
* Experience working with one of these databases - PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQL Server, OracleDB
* Experience with automated testing
* Distributed systems knowledge
* Fluency in English, verbal and written.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience with Python in production environments
* Hands-on experience with some of the following systems: Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, PostgreSQL, MySQL, ClickHouse, OpenSearch, Redis/Valkey
* Good understanding of security (software, networking)
* Experience and/or interest in infrastructure as code
* Experience in production software environments



  





**Our Offer** 




 If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
 



  





**We invest in you** 



* Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
* With Aiven locations spanning the globe, we want all of our crabs to find the right balance with our hybrid work policy.
* Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
* Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).
* Get comprehensive wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.



  





**Make a difference at Aiven** 



* Contribute to open source projects that you find relevant outside of work - and get paid for it. Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
* Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
* Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.



  





**What Else** 




 As well as the above Global Benefits, we have regional benefits specific to your country of residence. We would be happy to discuss these further with you during the interview process.
 



  





**Amazing, What’s Next** 




 If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we’ll get in touch!
 



  





**How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams** 




 There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
 



 Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
 



  





**Equal Opportunities** 




 Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven aligns with applicable local laws governing inclusivity in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
 



  





 At Aiven, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**About the Company** 




 Disruptive Novotech is at the forefront of innovation in wearable neuromodulation medical devices. As a dynamic and fast-growing start-up, the company is passionate about improving healthcare through cutting-edge technology. Join the team and help redefine the future of electro-stimulation.
 



  





**About the Position** 




 Are you a Frontend Developer passionate about building beautiful, fast, and user-friendly applications? We are looking for someone to take ownership of our frontend and be involved from the start in developing a premium product.
 



 Your key responsibilities:
 


* Develop and optimize mobile applications for both iOS and Android.
* Build a scalable and efficient frontend system that delivers a premium experience.
* Work closely with UI designers and backend developers.
* Ensure the applications load quickly, are bug-free, and provide a top-tier user experience.
* Contribute to decisions on frameworks and technical solutions.



  





**Qualifications and Characteristics** 




 The ideal candidate has experience developing frontend solutions for mobile and web apps, with a strong focus on systematization and performance. You are skilled in cross-platform development for Android and Apple, understand animations and complex performance optimizations, and take pride in delivering high-quality, efficient, and well-structured applications.
 



  





**We are looking for someone who:** 



* Has at least 5 years of frontend development experience, preferably focused on mobile apps.
* Has a university degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
* Has experience developing apps for both iOS and Android.
* Has a strong quality mindset and experience working with high UI/UX standards.
* Has experience with animations, caching, and performance optimization.
* Has experience with Bluetooth communication, preferably Bluetooth to an embedded product.
* Good to have experience with developing web-based applications.
* Thrives in a team environment and enjoys working with attention to detail.
* Meritorious to be familiar with software development according to regulatory frameworks for medical devices, for example, IEC 62304.



  





**Additional Information** 




 We apply an ongoing selection process so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible!
 



  





 If you have any questions don’t hesitate to reach out at jimmy@astaagency.se

title: Senior Frontend Developer
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Frontend Developer – HealthTech Startup | Stockholm (Onsite)** 




**Type: Permanent, Full-Time** 




  





 A well-funded, early-stage HealthTech startup based in Stockholm is looking for a Frontend Developer to join their growing team. They’ve just secured €2M in funding and are entering an exciting phase—scaling from proof-of-concept into full product development. Their mission? To help give children the healthiest start in life by combining cutting-edge microbiome science with AI.
 



  





 This is your chance to work on a product that genuinely improves lives—supporting families by tackling chronic health issues from the earliest stages of life.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing:** 



* Build scalable, maintainable mobile and web applications from the ground up using React Native (Expo)
* Collaborate with a tight-knit team of data scientists, founders, and developers to turn vision into reality
* Ensure smooth integrations and high performance across the product stack
* Shape new features based on customer feedback and real-world data
* Play a key role in product evolution, with the opportunity to step into a
 **technical leadership** 
 position



  





**What They’re Looking For:** 



* 3–5+ years of professional software development experience
* Solid hands-on experience with React Native (Expo)
* Practical mindset: know when to build from scratch vs. leverage tools/packages
* Familiarity with fast-paced startup environments, ideally with experience launching early-stage products
* Bonus: experience with Elixir/Phoenix



  





**Why You’ll Like It Here:** 



* Genuine impact: your work can improve health outcomes for children globally
* Equity options & 30 days of vacation
* Career path to tech lead / CTO
* Stable runway with a small, passionate team
* Office-based (Stockholm) to help get the foundation right—some flexibility offered for personal situations



  





*Please note: candidates must be located in Sweden with the right to work. Visa sponsorship is not available at this stage.*

title: Front End Developer - React Native
description:
**Frontend Developer – Join a Mission-Led Startup Improving Early Childhood Health** 




*Stockholm | Up to 58,000 SEK/month + options | Full-time, on-site* 




  





 We’re working with a Stockholm-based health tech startup that’s building a product designed to support healthier outcomes for children in their earliest years – and they’re now looking to bring in a Frontend Developer as they scale their product and team.
 



  





 Fresh off a successful funding round and with their first product launched, this is a rare chance to get in early and help shape a platform that combines science, data, and user-friendly technology to make a real-world difference in families' lives.
 



 They’re looking for someone who thrives in fast-paced startup environments, ideally someone who’s been part of taking a product from concept to launch (and all the iterations in between). If you’ve been in a small, ambitious team and know what it means to wear multiple hats while staying laser-focused on impact, this is the kind of challenge you’ll love.
 



  





 What they’re looking for:
 



 This role isn’t just about writing clean, scalable code – they want someone who’s passionate about the mission, excited to work in a small team, and eager to help build something meaningful from the ground up. They’re also hoping to find someone with natural leadership qualities, as they plan to grow a team around this hire over time.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Drive the development of new features across mobile and web using React Native (Expo)
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend teams to build seamless user experiences
* Help scale the product based on customer feedback and future vision
* Play a central role in the technical roadmap as the product evolves



**What you’ll need:** 



* 3–5+ years of software development experience
* Strong hands-on experience with React Native using Expo
* A good sense of when to build from scratch vs use off-the-shelf packages
* Previous experience in a startup or early-stage company, ideally across the full development lifecycle
* An appreciation for the pace, uncertainty, and impact that comes with startup life



**Bonus if you bring:** 



* Experience with Elixir/Phoenix
* Leadership experience or ambition to grow into a lead role



  





**Why join?** 



* Mission-led: your work will contribute to improving long-term health outcomes in early childhood
* Influence: small, tight-knit team where your ideas and decisions matter from day one
* Growth: stock options, long-term vision, and a company that’s just getting started
* 30 days’ vacation, flexible approach to work-life needs, and strong team culture



  





 This is a full-time, on-site position based in Stockholm. At this stage, only candidates already based in Sweden with full work rights can be considered.
 



  





  





**If you're excited by the idea of helping shape a high-impact product from the ground up – and you’ve got the technical and startup experience to match – we’d love to hear from you.**

title: Frontend developer / Product engineer
description:
**About Datastory** 




 Datastory (www.datastory.tech) is on a mission to curate, visualize, and explain knowledge so that more people find that spark to use and learn from data ✨. Our platform transforms data (whether it’s historical events, climate change data, government documents, or artificial intelligence research) into rich, interactive experiences that millions of people will use every day.
 



 If you are equally curious about the future of civic tech, visualization, data science, and scientific communication, apply to Datastory. Here, you get to work with some of the most forward-thinking organizations and people on the planet – always with the view towards building more sustainable applications anchored in
 *Humane Tech principles* 
 .
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We’re looking for a frontend developer who wants to build new product features from start to finish, using technologies like GraphQL, Github, and MobX. The features you develop will impact many users and are at the core of our product offering, such as:
 


* Our Platform experience for partners
* Data visualization tools
* UI components library
* Educational, multilingual websites



 You are a problem solver who likes to brainstorm solutions with teammates and can identify user experience issues before they ship. If needed, you can single-handedly craft effective UIs and come up with clever abstractions that save time and keep the codebase lean. You put users first and think about how to simplify their interactions with data-driven and educational content.
 



  





**A Few More Pointers About the Role** 



* Permanent and full-time position aimed at mid to senior level of experience.
* We're located in Stockholm, Sweden, but we're remote-first with colleagues in different countries.
* We primarily operate according to Swedish office hours (9 AM to 5 PM). However, we recognize the importance of work-life balance and are flexible with working hours to accommodate individual needs.
* You’ll mainly work with other developers on the team, but you'll likely collaborate with all team members at various points.
* We are seeking two frontend developers and will tailor the roles to your strengths. If interested, you may also support project managers in client meetings, particularly during requirements gathering and needs analysis.



  





**A Day in the Life Might Look Like** 



* Help build our internal data visualization tool tapping into our Knowledge Graph API, by working on improving its core, adding new data visualization templates, etc.
* Implement UI components based on Figma design and UI/UX specifications, working on polishing all the details that make it accessible and delightful for users.
* Implement complex data visualizations for our partners/clients, comprised of interactive chart(s) and a set of controls allowing users to customize it.
* Improve UI library documentation, fixing errors, keeping it up to date, adding useful code examples, and filling in missing docs.
* Expand test coverage of our codebase, both unit and end-to-end (e2e) tests.
* Add GitHub issues, participate in RFCs and other discussions around various APIs we create or use.
* Create your own and review PRs from your colleagues.



  





**Our Stack and Technology** 



* Base: TypeScript, React/Next.js, Svelte
* UI: ChakraUI, Ant Design
* API: Knowledge Graph exposed via GraphQL API
* Data Visualization: D3, LayerCake/LayerChart
* Mapping: MapboxGL, React Simple Maps
* Testing: Jest, Cypress



  





**Skills You’ll Need to Bring** 



* Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to clearly describe concepts to non-technical clients and understand their requirements.
* Effective planning, prioritization, and organization of your work independently, as well as in collaboration with other engineers.
* Proven ability to develop efficient frontend code, ideally using frameworks like React, Svelte, or similar.
* Understanding of, and ideally experience with building GraphQL or other APIs.
* A deep interest in the full-stack technology landscape and ideally other interests relevant to the Datastory mission of spreading knowledge (history, arts, geography, socioeconomics, etc.).
* Familiarity with various headless Content Management Systems (CMS) is advantageous.
* Experience in productization and transforming services or ideas into marketable products.
* Excellent command of English and the ability to articulate complex ideas in pseudocode and code.



  





**Application Process** 



* Step 1: Send an email to our CTO at
 **arek@datastory.org** 
 with the subject “Frontend Developer” and briefly explain why this role is interesting to you. Please include any materials we can use to assess your fit for the position (e.g., resume, portfolio, GitHub profile).
* Step 2: The next step is an initial call with us where we can learn more about you and answer any questions you may have.
* Step 3: The final step is a take-home assignment where you’ll implement a well-scoped and design-specified UI component, matching our remote-first, async workflow or participate in a technical interview.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Frontend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about frontend technologies
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Are you fluent in Swedish? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Frontend Developer** 




 Your role as a Frontend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



  





 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



  





 In addition, you will:
 


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy frontend solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of front-end development. You’re passionate about building scalable, and maintainable user interfaces and enjoy collaborating with teams across functions to deliver exceptional digital experiences.
 



 As a person, you are flexible and adaptable and can see yourself thriving in working in a fast-paced start-up like environment.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, frontend development
* At least 5 years of experience in frontend development, especially within modern frontend stacks
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG, etc.) to build inclusive and compliant web applications
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Due to a client requirement, fluency in Swedish is a strict requirement for this position



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* Proficiency in React, Vue, Next.js or other React frameworks
* Javascript, HTML, CSS
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence



  





 Read more about Valtech and what you can expect from us by clicking on "Apply".

title: Software Engineer - Open banking
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 At Tink, we deliver open banking solutions as a part of Visa. We’re creating the foundations that a new world of finance will be built on. By constantly challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing the ground-breaking services that businesses will use, to revolutionize the way millions of people manage their money. The world of financial services is changing fast, and we will continue to be at the forefront of it.
   

  

 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  





**What we offer you:** 
  

  





 You will be working in an international environment where your responsibilities will include:
   

  




* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Datadog, REST and much more.


* Develop reliable, scalable, high performance and highly distributed systems that power open banking products for different markets using your technical expertise.


* Innovate around new features and measure how these features perform, being instrumental in bringing the product vision to life.


* Collaborate and build high-quality products by following best engineering practices.



 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  

  





 This is a hybrid position, and we would like you to be in office three days per week.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Engineering organization, working from our office in central Stockholm. We see that you enjoy working with others and that you have a passion for what you do. You want to better the product you are working on as well as your knowledge and skills.
   

  





 We would like you to have:
   

  




* Proven experience working as backend engineer with Java technologies


* Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric


* Experience from working with DevOps methodologies and tools


* Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
*Hej, jag heter Niklas och är CTO på BookBeat. Roligt att just du är intresserad av att koda med oss! Jag söker nu dig som Frontend-utvecklare till vårt content team.* 




  





*Jag tror att du har minst 3 års erfarenhet av webbutveckling och om du har en universitetsexamen i ryggen är det meriterande. Du har en passion för att bygga en bra produkt och är engagerad i att skapa mjukvara på högsta nivå. Gissningsvis har du också en stark vilja att lära dig och öka din kompetens, samt att dela med dig av din kunskap till andra.* 




  





 Som en nyckelspelare i vårt Content Developers team kommer du att vara en del av vår produktutveckling, där dina idéer och kod blir till verkliga verktyg som dagligen används av både våra interna användare samt förlagspartners. I den här rollen kommer du tillsammans med teamet ansvara för att den tekniska plattformen håller hög kvalitet – en intern plattform som är navet i att hantera katalogen av böcker samt en extern webb som erbjuder insikter till förlag. Du kommer även arbeta med features från idé till färdig produkt och bli en del av en öppen företagskultur där lärande och kunskapsdelning är av stor vikt.
 



  





 Med över 1 miljon aktiva användare i 30 länder är lasten allt annat än trivial, vilket ställer stora krav på prestanda och skalbarhet. Det gör arbetet väldigt omväxlande och utmanande.
 



  





 Jag vill att du är väldigt nyfiken, inte bara på teknik och kod, utan även på hur och varför saker görs. Det kan handla om allt från teknik och domän till människor, team och organisation. Du förstår att det är helheten som spelar roll i slutändan.
 



 Du inser vikten av att vara öppen för nya idéer och att dela med dig av dina kunskaper med andra utvecklare och specialister för att både BookBeat och du själv ska kunna utvecklas.
 



  





 Jag tror också att du är engagerad i det du gör och i ditt yrke; du bryr dig på riktigt om det som du och ditt team skickar till produktion och vilken effekt det ger.
 



  





 Tillsammans är vårt gemensamma mål på BookBeat att bygga Europas bästa tjänst för att hitta och uppleva digitala böcker.
 



  





 Du kommer, tillsammans med resten av utvecklingsteamen på BookBeat, att ha en viktig roll i hur vi skapar den bästa möjliga upplevelsen för våra över 1 miljon kunder och oss själva.
 



  





 Vårt kontor ligger på Sveavägen 56, rätt nära Webhallen.
 



  





 Språkmässigt har du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





**Rollen innebär bland annat att:** 



* Skriva kod
* Tillsammans med teamet ansvara för att den tekniska plattformen håller hög kvalitet
* Arbeta med features från idé till färdig produkt
* Agera mentor och dela med dig av din kunskap
* Se till att
 
 den tekniska plattformen är tillgänglig och presterar på topp



  





**Jag tror du är grym på:** 



* React
* TypeScript
* Next.js
* CSS
* Testning (unit och e2e)



  





**Det är meriterande om du dessutom har erfarenhet av:** 



* Humor
* Accessibility
* Cloud (Azure/k8s)
* CI/CD
* Tracking, analytics och A/B-testning



  





 Om du är intresserad—skicka in din ansökan och berätta om din erfarenhet och varför du är rätt kandidat för oss! Vid frågor är du välkommen att höra av dig till mig, Niklas Arbin, på niklas.arbin@bookbeat.com.
 



  





**Som anställd på BookBeat AB erbjuds du ett förmånspaket som inkluderar:** 




 🌴 30 dagar semester per år
 



 💰 ITP1-tjänstepension
 



 💌 TGL (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring), TFA (trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada) & tjänstereseförsäkring
 



 🎾 Årligt friskvårdsbidrag
 



 🤸‍♂️ Veckovis friskvårdstimme
 



 💻 Arbetsutrustning (dator och telefon) samt abonnemang
 



 🎧 BookBeat prenumeration
 



 🏥Företagshälsovård för att säkerställa ditt välmående
 



 👶Föräldraledighetsförmån för att stödja din växande familj
 



 📃Kollektivavtal
 



  





**Utöver våra förmåner erbjuder vi dig också:** 




 💜 En stabil och hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid med en arbetsvecka på 37,9 timmar
 



 🏢 Ett kontor i centrala Stockholm
 



 🐶... som faktiskt är hundvänligt! Det betyder att du kan ta med din lurviga vän till vårt särskilda hundrum
 



 🏃‍♀️ Gissa vad? På vårt Stockholmskontor har vi också tillgång till ett nyrenoverat gym med bastu!
 



 🏡 Flexibilitet i form av t.ex. flexibla arbetstider och vår policy för hybridarbete
 



 🚀 Möjligheten att växa i din roll och karriär, inklusive utmanande och lärorika arbetsuppgifter samt andra möjligheter till utveckling
 



 ✨ Roliga aktiviteter med kollegor! På BookBeat får du ta del av veckovisa "Friday afternoon mingles", månatliga företagsfrukostar och andra härliga arbetsrelaterade aktiviteter regelbundet tillsammans med hela företaget
 



 🧪 Möjligheten att utforska projekt du inte har tid för i ditt dagliga arbete under våra Hack Days
 



 🧠 Kunskapsdelningsmöjligheter, exempelvis under våra veckovisa "Friday demos" tillsammans med hela företaget där olika team delar vad de har jobbat på, jobbar på eller kommer jobba på. Kunskapsdelning är också en viktig del av vårt dagliga arbete!
 



 🤛 (Sist men inte minst) ett härligt och kompetent team och chef som kommer stötta dig genom din anställning!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 År 2015 påbörjade vi vår resa mot målet att erbjuda Europas ledande tjänst för digitala böcker, och 2016 lanserade vi till allmänheten. Nu, snart 9 år efter vår breda lansering, används BookBeat av över 1 miljon användare varje månad. Vi är ett ständigt växande företag inom Bonnierkoncernen och alla medlemmar som är del av vår resa har möjlighet att påverka vår utveckling – både på kort och lång sikt.
 



  





 Idag består Team BookBeat av 160 nyfikna och engagerade "doers". Är du intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team? Underbart! Våra anställda är experter på många olika områden, men vi har fyra kärnvärderingar som enar oss alla:
 



  





 🚀 Var fantastisk på det du gör
 



 📣 Dela det du vet och kan
 



 🔎 Nyfikenhet för våra användare och oss
 



 🤝 Bygg Team BookBeat
 



  





 Med andra ord: vi vill att våra medarbetare kontinuerligt ska djupdyka i och utvecklas inom sina kompetensområden, men också att de delar den kunskapen med sina kollegor – vi är alla del av Team BookBeat och samarbetar (oftast mycket) dagligen! Vi söker också medarbetare som är genuint nyfikna på våra användare samt på vår resa och organisation, en nyfikenhet som driver oss till att alltid testa nya saker i vår tjänst och att låta våra användare visa oss om vi är på rätt väg. Sist men definitivt inte minst vill vi att våra anställda ska bidra till Team BookBeats vardagliga samarbete och välmående – som redan nämnt är vi alla del av ett större team, ett team som vi vill ska må bra och ha kul på jobbet, något vi alla bidrar till på olika sätt.

title: Frontend Developer Revenue Engineering
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack Your Brand is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services to more than 50,000 businesses in over 70 countries, from the café round the corner to bigger brands like McDonald's, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer.
   

  

 The company consists of 90+ talented, motivated and humble employees. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion. Our headquarters are located in central Stockholm (Odenplan).
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We're looking for a frontend engineer to join our Revenue Engineering team.
   

  

 The team is responsible for subscription & account management, checkout, product packaging & expansion/upsell.
   

  

 As a frontend engineer, you be involved in the whole feature development lifecycle from ideation to implementation, in close collaboration with other engineers, product owners, UX/UI designers and analysts. You will help ensure that our customers, whether small business owners or enterprise clients, have a smooth journey from onboarding to expansion.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain our web and mobile clients, collaborating closely with designers
* Work on multiple frontend codebases, optimize system performance, reliability, and cost efficiency
* Build and refine APIs to support subscription and account management
* Making sure our systems stay performant, reliable and cost efficient
* Run A/B tests end-to-end with the analytics team to iterate on functionality
* Contribute to a supportive, knowledge-sharing team culture


**About You**
 We believe that great engineers come from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

 You're someone who thrives in a collaborative environment, enjoying the process of solving problems as part of a team. With a curious and open mindset, you're always eager to learn, explore new ideas, and embrace challenges.
   

  

 You know how to prioritise and adapt in a fast-moving setting while keeping sight of the bigger picture. Open communication is important to you, and you feel comfortable both giving and receiving constructive feedback in a supportive and respectful way.
   

  

 With at least five years of experience as a frontend engineer, you have worked with web frameworks, large codebases, and A/B testing, bringing both technical expertise and a growth-oriented approach to your work.
   

  

 Your experience
   

  

* You feel at home building robust, maintainable web apps
* Strong proficiency in TypeScript and JavaScript
* You’ve worked with React and React Native before
* Comfortable with Git, Node, (p)npm and RN/browser dev tools
* Services are accessed using GraphQL and REST.
* Automated testing (especially front-end), for example with Jest/Vitest and Playwright


 Employee benefits
   

  

* You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites


 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Marcus Revfalk at marcus@soundtrackyourbrand.com. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by email.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Stockholm Water offers you an exciting role where you will contribute to the development of next-generation sustainable water purification.
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Software Developer** 
 to join our team within Embedded, IoT, and Cloud to contribute to the development of next-generation sustainable water purification. The opportunity is to have a tangible impact on people's lives and the environment by providing clean and sustainable water solutions for markets ranging from industrial input water to the recirculation of industrial and municipal wastewater. Your role will be focused on the embedded software aspects relating to software architecture optimization, firmware design, data collection & transfer and interfaces & data analysis for engaging with the system from a customer and technician level,
 



  





**About The Role** 




 In your role as a Software Developer, you will be part of the product development team, where you will conduct R&D and operations tasks. With the help of people in the team, you will analyse customer requirements and translate them into functional specifications, implement new features and validate internally and at customer sites. In addition to development work, you will be involved in system installations from time to time.
 



 You will also have the opportunity to take up responsibility and ownership of the design of next-generation hardware, firmware, and cloud architecture.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




**Who are you?** 



* We are looking for someone who has an interest and knowledge of technology.
* You have probably worked or are working at a company that has similar technical solutions as Stockholm Water.
* You have been proactive in organization, design, and problem-solving.
* You have previous experience through professional, academic and/or project work in embedded software development.
* You should have knowledge of C, Python, Linux and software architecture as well as an understanding of microelectronics.
* You probably have a bachelor's or a master's in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent.
* We prefer that you work from our office in northern Stockholm, but other options can be discussed.



  





**What do we offer?** 




 In addition to a market-based salary, we offer the opportunity to join a journey where we can work together for a better environment and ensure clean water for more people.
 



 Stockholm Water Technology is a Stockholm-based company with a lot of entrepreneurial spirit and a good atmosphere among employees. We think it is important that we also have fun along the way.
 



  





**How to Apply for this position?** 




 Please click on the apply button, and attach your CV. Please note that a portfolio of past projects (IoT, Embedded, App, Cloud, or equivalent) is also appreciated right away and becomes compulsory later in the recruitment process.
 



  





**Looking forward to meeting you!**

title: Software Developer – Open-Source Developer Portal & DevOps
description:
We are looking for developers to build a new team with a focus on establishing and further developing a developer portal based on open-source technology. The goal is to create a "one-stop shop" for developers – a central platform where development teams can test and explore IT solutions virtually.
 



 The team will be responsible for the development environment and driving work with DevOps methodology – quickly, iteratively, and with a focus on automation and user-friendliness. You will lay the foundation for internal development efficiency and contribute to standardizing and improving the developer experience.

 and how to create reusable solutions

title: Mobile SDK Developer - Hybrid - Stockholm
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our mobile client SDKs are key to how our customers integrate their products with our platform. We have clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises, and their mobile apps are used by millions of people worldwide. By developing our voice and video SDKs together with the team, you will play a pivotal role in powering all those real-time conversations.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Mobile SDK Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing mobile SDKs while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop SDKs using WebRTC technology to optimize real-time communication features.
* Work with the team to align SDK APIs and features across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and Web/JavaScript.
* Develop cross-platform solutions using a C++ codebase shared between iOS and Android.
* Design APIs with simplicity in mind while maintaining modularity, extensibility, and API stability over time.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Professional expertise in modern C++, especially in mobile applications development.
* Professional experience developing for the iOS and/or Android platform.
* Experience with at least one of Kotlin or Objective-C/Swift.
* Experience working in Linux/macOS development environments and CI pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Experience with WebRTC protocols and NAT traversal, including ICE, STUN, and TURN, is a significant advantage.
* Experience developing software libraries and/or SDKs consumed by other developers.
* In-depth knowledge of network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, and DNS.
* Great debugging and troubleshooting skills.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Software Engineer, Storage
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 As a Software Engineer on the evroc Storage team, you will help lay the foundations of highly performant and scalable cloud storage solutions operating at mission-critical levels of availability and durability. You will be involved in all phases of the product lifecycle including design, architecture, development, deployment and maintenance.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Design, develop and maintain evroc’s cloud storage offerings including S3 object storage, block storage and shared file systems.
* Build components using first principles from the ground up to unlock optimization opportunities at every layer of the stack.
* Optimize existing cloud storage solutions for performance ensuring low latency and high throughput, high reliability and cost effectiveness.
* Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements. Leverage a variety of feedback channels to incorporate insights into future designs or solution fixes.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack. Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Coding in programming languages such as C, C++, Golang or Rust.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in building and enhancing clustered storage solutions such as Ceph, Gluster, HDFS, Lustre or MinIO or cloud storage such as AWS S3, EBS, GCP’s Blob/Block/File Storage.
* Extensive experience within the Kubernetes ecosystem developing and running highly available services. Helm, Kustomize, Knative, Rook and controller runtime knowledge is a plus.
* Deep understanding of databases, file systems and storage protocols. (Bonus) experience in Solid-State Drive (SSD)/NAND or Hard Disk Drive (HDD) based storage technologies, interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SATA/SAS), and security standards (TCG).
* Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization techniques.
* Active engagement or contributions to the open-source community.
* Collaborative, curious, and pragmatic Software Engineer who wants to be part of an innovative team.


 Please note you do not need to have experience with all of the technologies listed above to apply. If your background is in storage technologies and distributed systems, and you are passionate about building a better cloud, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Dotnet Developer
description:
*Var med på resan att bli Europas ledande och mest hållbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor!* 




  





**Om Agria** 




 Agria är ett av Europas största djurförsäkringsbolag. Agria växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike och Irland. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vård Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning. Hos Agria är målet är att tillsammans skapa en arbetsmiljö där alla trivs, har roligt, växer och mår bra. Agria strävar efter att erbjuda en plats som främjar kontinuerligt lärarande och där du blir en del av ett prestigelöst team som arbetar utifrån kunden och deras djurs bästa.
 



 Du kommer att tillhöra teamet Kompetenscenter som har ansvar för att säkerställa bemanning och kompetens i Agrias virtuella leveransorganisation. Här hittar du skickliga utvecklare inom olika tekniker, produktägare, affärsanalytiker, kravledare, QA-testare och Scrum Masters.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Agria står inför en spännande moderniseringsresa. Deras försäkringssystem är idag byggda i CA Plex, men dom arbetar aktivt med att förflytta funktionalitet till ny teknik med hjälp av .NET. Vi söker nu engagerade och nyfikna utvecklare som vill vara med och driva denna förändring framåt samtidigt som du blir en del av Career Accelerator Program. Läs mer om Career Accelerator Program här.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckla och vidareutveckla funktionalitet i .NET och Azure.
* Lära dig och arbeta med CA Plex för att förstå och flytta funktionalitet till modern teknik.
* Bygga bryggor mellan det gamla och nya systemet för att säkerställa en smidig förflyttning.
* Samarbeta med erfarna utvecklare, testare och produktägare i en inkluderande och prestigelös miljö.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att lyckas i denna roll tror vi att du har:
 


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område så som datavetenskap med fokus på .NET
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av .NET core och Azure.
* Grundläggande förståelse för SQL och databashantering.
* Nyfikenhet och driv att lära dig nya teknologier, inklusive CA Plex.
* En öppenhet för att arbeta med både gamla och nya teknologier under förflyttningen.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska



  





 Det är också meriterande om du har:
 



  




* Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder
* Erfarenhet av React eller Typescript



  





**Men viktigast av allt så tror vi att du är:** 



* En prestigelös problemlösare som är nyfiken på att lära dig både gamla och nya teknologier
* Engagerad och kommunikativ, att du trivs att dela med dig av dina insikter och kunskaper
* Självgående, driven och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ



  





**Vad erbjuder Career Accelerator Programmet:** 



* Utbildning en gång per månad inom olika område
* Utbildning inom tekniska verktyg så som .NET, Cyber Security och AI bland annat
* Utbildning inom personlig utveckling så som självledarskap och kommunikation
* Individuell karriärscoaching
* Sociala event så som AWs tillsammans med andra deltagare i Career Accelerator Program



  





**Vad Agria erbjuder:** 



* Utbildning inom CA Plex
* En unik möjlighet att vara en del av en internationell organisation som är i en expansiv fas
* Ett kompetent och prestigelöst team där du får stor möjlighet att påverka
* En arbetsplats där du får jobba både en digital förändringsresa
* En roll där du kan utvecklas och forma din egen väg i en växande miljö

title: System Developer - Core Team
description:
*RaySearch develops innovative software solutions to improve cancer care. About 1000 clinics in more than 40 countries use RaySearch software to improve treatments and quality of life for patients. RaySearch was founded in 2000 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. The headquarters is located in Stockholm, with subsidiaries in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia & New Zealand. Today we are more than 400 employees with a common vision of improving cancer care with innovative software. Our great staff is crucial for our success and we offer a fantastic working environment in modern offices, flexibility and good opportunities for development. We believe in equal opportunities, value diversity and work actively to prevent discrimination.*
 RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking to add more talented developers to our oncology information system RayCare, specifically to our Core team which is responsible for framework development.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is a client-server application that runs on premises at many clinics all over the world. RayCare takes care of and helps clinical staff to coordinate their work at the clinic. For example, workflow management, patient chart details and treatment management. RayCare is an innovative oncology information system (OIS) designed to support the complex challenges of modern oncology clinics. It is developed to streamline workflows in cancer clinics to facilitate efficient care faster to more patients. RayCare is used by all staff at the clinic, e.g., physicians, physicists, treatment planners etc. and is used in all steps of patient care, from registration to radiation treatment at the treatment machine and for treatment follow-up. RayCare is integrated with RayStation and its treatment tools but also with external products and supports communication via HL7 as well as DICOM.
   

  

 In the Core team you will mainly work with developing and improving our mission-critical event sourcing and micro service framework as well as installation and security aspects for the RayCare product.
   

  

 As a part of the Core team, you have the possibility to work with a variety of interesting and challenging tasks together with talented colleagues and contribute to evolving the platform and ensuring that it meets the high requirements on patient safety, robustness and availability.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a core team developer, you will be part of designing and implementing a robust and modern software platform for our oncology information system. We believe you are a hands-on system developer with great problem-solving skills and a meticulous and structured approach. RayCare has high demands on sustainable software development ensuring excellent code quality and maintaining best practices. In your everyday work, you continuously contribute to good overall software design with the goal of achieving a highly structured large scale software product. You are always open to discuss overall design within and between teams, valuing collaboration and your colleagues input to find the best solution for the problem at hand.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have excellent analytic skills and can identify different components of problems, see connections between them, and understand the impact of various proposed solutions. You take responsibility for your work, ensuring that nothing is overlooked when implementing new functionality. You value collaboration, share knowledge with you team, and take pride in delivering high-quality code that supports the teams’ and organization's goals.
   

  

**Requirements:**
* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering physics or equivalent academic degree
* Minimum five years of backend development experience with complex products
* Expertise in C#/.NET
* Proficient with SQL Server
* Experience with client-server based systems
* Knowledge of domain-driven design
* Knowledge of event-sourcing


**Meriting:**
* Experience of working in an agile environment
* Experience from the MedTech-industry or other regulated industries
* Experience of framework development of mission critical systems
* Experience from microservice architectures
* Knowledge of CQRS/CQS
* High performance computing (multi-threaded/async software)
* Messaging systems such as RabbitMQ
* Experience with security technologies such as; OpenID Connect, certificates, IdentityServer/OpenIddict


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer (QA)
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Visa’s Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  





  

  





**The Opportunity:**




 As a Senior Full Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining web services, with an additional focus on Software Testing. You will work with your team to ensure that the end user experience of the Tink payments and account check products is reliable, scalable, and resilient.
   

  





 Here are some of the key tasks and responsibilities:
   

  




* Collaborating with product and delivery teams,
* Regularly deploy our work to production and assure the quality by automated tests and monitoring.
* Be responsible for the availability of the services the team owns, have SLOs/SLIs in place as well as an on-call rotation.



  

  





**The Skills You Bring:**




 We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer with experience in collaborating with product teams, designers, and other stakeholders. Strong organizational and communication skills are essential, along with the ability to give and receive feedback effectively. The candidate should be self-motivated and proactive in identifying and driving opportunities for improvement.
   

  





  

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* Full Stack engineer with previous QA experience
* Experience writing, releasing, maintaining web applications.
* Comfortable with HTML, CSS and Typescript.
* Experience with modern web application development in React.
* Experience with methods for managing application state, such as Xstate, Redux, Reflux, Flux or similar.
* Experience with updating and maintaining a backend service.
* Ability to recognize and implement modern product design.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Software Engineer (MySQL)
description:
We’re a global team working together to push the boundaries of open-source technology and multi-cloud solutions. Our vision is to become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone, leveraging the most popular open-source technologies like Aiven for MySQL®, Aiven for PostgreSQL®, Apache Kafka®, Aiven for Clickhouse®, and Aiven for OpenSearch®. to help companies accelerate time-to-market, drive efficiency, and build innovative solutions across any cloud. Right now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to join our team who shares our passion for forward-thinking and innovative approaches.
 



  





**About This Team** 




 At Aiven, we believe engineers can drive significant impact through coding and problem solving. Here, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to challenging projects that transcend any specific framework or cloud provider, work alongside exceptional engineers, and continuously expand your technical expertise. We strive to create an environment that encourages problem solving and results over following directions, so we make better decisions for our customers, our products and our employees.
 



  





**Who We Are** 




 So, how do we become the trusted open source data platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That’s why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we’re by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn’t just about who we are. It’s about who our customers are – and where they want to be.
 



  





**Our Crabby Principles** 




 Aiveners use the V2MOM framework to set and align on business goals. In order to achieve those business goals we live by our ‘Crabby Principles’ which unite us in our ways of working, globally.
 



  





 These principles are embedded in our business processes and support us in collaborating and role modelling positive and productive behaviours in our daily work, something you will have the opportunity to demonstrate throughout your interview journey with us.
 



  





**The Role:** 




 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best data technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You’ll be part of the team that is focused on developing the relational database services and improving their scalability and reliability for our customers and OEM partners.
 



 Our philosophy is to deliver efficient and scalable solutions by continuously evolving and enhancing our product capabilities. Our own backend systems are mostly implemented in Python with bits of Java, Go and C.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 



* Write high-quality, maintainable code and release quality features.
* Participate in technical discussions and perform PR reviews.
* Contribute to technical planning and backlog management.
* Help investigate and resolve customer issues.
* Mentor and empower other engineers.
* Automate processes to eliminate repetitive manual work.
* Develop and improve the scalability and reliability of the data services powered by Aiven, with a specific focus on MySQL.



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
 



**Must Have:** 



* Excellent development skills in Python
* 5+ years of experience working with one of these databases - PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQL Server, OracleDB
* Experience with backup solutions and backup strategies
* Advanced understanding of Linux OS
* Experience with large scale production workloads
* Experience with automated testing
* Distributed systems knowledge
* Experience with performance improvements, bug fixes, and security vulnerability resolution
* Fluency in English, verbal and written.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Good understanding of security (software, networking)
* Experience in infrastructure as code
* Experience in cloud DBAAS production environments
* Experience in production software environments
* Experience with one or more of Kafka, Clickhouse, Redis/Valkey, Opensearch



  





**Our Offer** 




 If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
 



  





**We invest in you** 



* Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
* With Aiven locations spanning the globe, we want all of our crabs to find the right balance with our hybrid work policy.
* Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
* Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).
* Get comprehensive wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.



  





**Make a difference at Aiven** 



* Contribute to open source projects that you find relevant outside of work - and get paid for it. Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
* Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
* Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.



  





**What Else** 




 As well as the above Global Benefits, we have regional benefits specific to your country of residence. We would be happy to discuss these further with you during the interview process.
 



  





**Amazing, What’s Next** 




 If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we’ll get in touch!
 



  





**How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams** 




 There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
 



 Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
 



  





**Equal Opportunities** 




 Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven aligns with applicable local laws governing inclusivity in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
 



  





 At Aiven, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
