title: Kravanalytiker
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **5+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:


Kund söker en kravanalytiker som ska ta fram och ansvara för funktionella krav inom utvecklingen av system för modellförvaltning, avbrottshantering och datautbyte med externa aktörer. I rollen ingår också att hålla workshops och samordna kravaktiviteter med projektteam samt rapportera kravarbetets framdrift till förvaltningsledare/projektledare. Som kravanalytiker hos kund, leder och driver du kravarbetet i ett eller flera projekt eller linjeuppdrag med IT-påverkan. Projekten kan omfatta både egenutveckling eller införande av standardsystem och bemannas av verksamhetsspecialister och interna/externa resurser inom IT.


Kund arbetar i stor utsträckning med agilt genomförande där det passar och ser att konsulten ska ha erfarenhet av kravhantering och att formulera krav för en agil utveckling. Konsulten bör även vara van att arbeta i team tillsammans med projektledare, processledare, lösningsarkitekter och testledare.


Arbetsuppgifter


I rollen som Kravanalytiker kommer du att samarbeta med experter internt hos kund och bygga kunskap om dataförvaltning och driften av kraftsystemet. Rollen innebär att:

* Samla in funktionella och icke-funktionella krav genom workshops och enhetligt dokumentera resultatet av kravarbetet
* Säkerställa att kraven kommuniceras och förankras med och mellan olika kravställare
* Koordinera kraven med verksamhets- och IT-arkitekter
* Säkerställa att kraven är skrivna på ett utvecklingsbart och testbart sätt
* Ge metodstöd inom kravhantering till verksamhetsspecialister/kravställare avseende både funktionella och icke-funktionella krav med särskild betoning på användbarhet

Bidra till att utveckla kravprocess och strategi i samarbete med andra krav- och testledare hos kund  
* 

**Obligatoriska krav**

* Högskoleutbildning 120hp/180hp inom systemvetenskap, informatik eller relevant ingenjörsutbildning

**Ko****mpetens och erfarenhet**

* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av kravställning av verksamhetsprojekt med flera behovsägare med betydande inslag av IT, agil kravställning och systemutveckling
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling inom kravställning
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ta fram och dokumentera arbetsflöden och processer vid IT-förändringar, enligt Astrakanmetoden eller liknande
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med något/några kravverktyg, t.ex. Azure, ADOS, JIRA m.fl.

**Mervärdeskrav**

* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med kravställning inom teknik och infrastruktur
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsmodellering
* Certifiering enligt IREB, REQB eller motsvarande certifiering
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom verksamhetsarkitektur eller informationsarkitektur
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av UX-design eller användbarhetskunskap

 **Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Kravanalytiker
description:
Vi söker en kravanalytiker till myndighet i Stockholm.


Detta är ett konsultuppdrag.


Tjänsten är på heltid, och säkerhetsprövning krävs.


Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.

**Uppdraget**


Myndigheten är den som ansvarar för att elöverföringssystemet är säkert, miljöanpassat och kostnadseffektivt - idag och i framtiden.  

  

Myndigheten söker en kravanalytiker som ska ta fram och ansvara för funktionella krav inom utvecklingen av system för modellförvaltning, avbrottshantering och datautbyte med externa aktörer. I rollen ingår också att hålla workshops och samordna kravaktiviteter med projektteam samt rapportera kravarbetets framdrift till förvaltningsledare/projektledare. Som kravanalytiker på myndigheten, leder och driver du kravarbetet i ett eller flera projekt eller linjeuppdrag med IT-påverkan. Projekten kan omfatta både egenutveckling eller införande av standardsystem och bemannas av verksamhetsspecialister och interna/externa resurser inom IT.


Myndigheten arbetar i stor utsträckning med agilt genomförande där det passar och ser att konsulten ska ha erfarenhet av kravhantering och att formulera krav för en agil utveckling. Konsulten bör även vara van att arbeta i team tillsammans med projektledare, processledare, lösningsarkitekter och testledare.

 **Arbetsuppgifter**


I rollen som Kravanalytiker kommer du att samarbeta med experter internt på myndigheten och bygga kunskap om dataförvaltning och driften av kraftsystemet. Rollen innebär att:

* Samla in funktionella och icke-funktionella krav genom workshops och enhetligt dokumentera resultatet av kravarbetet
* Säkerställa att kraven kommuniceras och förankras med och mellan olika kravställare
* Koordinera kraven med verksamhets- och IT-arkitekter
* Säkerställa att kraven är skrivna på ett utvecklingsbart och testbart sätt
* Ge metodstöd inom kravhantering till verksamhetsspecialister/kravställare avseende både funktionella och icke-funktionella krav med särskild betoning på användbarhet
* Bidra till att utveckla kravprocess och strategi i samarbete med andra krav- och testledare

 **Krav (Obligatoriska)**  

  

Högskoleutbildning 120hp/180hp inom systemvetenskap, informatik eller relevant ingenjörsutbildning  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av kravställning av verksamhetsprojekt med flera behovsägare med betydande inslag av IT, agil kravställning och systemutveckling  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling inom kravställning  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ta fram och dokumentera arbetsflöden och processer vid IT-förändringar, enligt Astrakanmetoden eller liknande  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med något/några kravverktyg, t.ex. Azure, ADOS, JIRA m.fl.

 **Meriterande**

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med kravställning inom teknik och infrastruktur  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsmodellering  

Certifiering enligt IREB, REQB eller motsvarande certifiering  

Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom verksamhetsarkitektur eller informationsarkitektur  

Minst 5 års erfarenhet av UX-design eller användbarhetskunskap


**Om oss**


Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.


Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.


Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.


För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.


Läs gärna mer om oss på centio.se.

**Vänligen skicka ditt CV på svenska.**

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Teknikinformatör – skapa framtidens tekniska dokumentation
description:
Är du en teknikinformatör med minst 2 års erfarenhet och en passion för att skapa tydlig och användarvänlig teknisk dokumentation? Vill du arbeta i ett dynamiskt team där du har möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas? Då kan det här vara jobbet för dig!

**Vad rollen innebär**


Vi söker flera teknikinformatörer till vårt växande team – både generalister och specialister. Oavsett din bakgrund kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att skapa strukturerad, användarvänlig och högkvalitativ teknisk dokumentation. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:

* Skapa, uppdatera och underhålla teknisk dokumentation med hjälp av XML och DITA.
* Arbeta i ett CMS för att strukturera och hantera innehåll effektivt.
* Samarbeta med olika stakeholders för att säkerställa en optimal användarupplevelse.
* Driva förbättringar inom dokumentationsprocesser och informationsstruktur.

**Vem du är**

  

* En skicklig kommunikatör med förmåga att anpassa teknisk information till olika målgrupper.
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet av teknikinformation.
* Har gedigen kunskap i XML, CMS och topic-baserat skrivande.
* Behärskar både svenska och engelska obehindrat.
* Har erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika team och intressenter.
* Har en stark känsla för struktur och noggrannhet.

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av UX-writing eller arbete med användarupplevelse.
* Intresse för och erfarenhet av att utveckla team och processer.
* Erfarenhet inom AI-drivna informationslösningar, kognitionsvetenskap eller UX-design.

**Varför Aleido?**

* **Innovativ miljö**: Hos oss får du arbeta med de senaste AI- och teknologitrenderna, i en kultur som värderar ständig utveckling och lärande.
* **Flexibelt arbete:** Hos oss finns möjlighet till en flexibel arbetsvardag, där distansarbete kombineras med närvaro på kontoret.
* **Utveckling i fokus**: Vi erbjuder en lärandekultur där du ständigt utmanas och har möjlighet att växa. Vårt löfte om lärande innebär att vi delar kunskap generöst och värdesätter din strävan att växa.
* **Hållbar framtid**: Vår vision är att skapa tekniska lösningar som är både innovativa och hållbara.

**Vilka vi är**


Aleido är ett internationellt företag med lång tradition av att driva utvecklingen av eftermarknadsinformation och utbildningslösningar. Våra kunder utvecklar komplexa produkter eller system, eller söker kunskap och beredskap för att skapa varaktig förändring, inom en mängd branscher såsom fordon, telekom, industri, järnväg och medicinteknik. Vi är närmare tusen kollegor i fem länder. Tillsammans överbryggar vi klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som är beroende av den – genom att göra det avancerade lätt att förstå.
company_description: Our mission is to bridge the gap between technology and people by making the advanced simply understood.

title: Integration Engineer - Customs EUR
description:
Opportunity


*Think Global, Work Local* *with Maersk Customs Service!*

*Are you ready to be part of an organization on an industry-defining transformation journey that will change the world?*

*Maersk, a global leader in logistics, is on a journey to transform the logistics industry and Customs Services is at the heart of this integrator strategy. With end-to-end customs visibility, Maersk Customs Services, offer global reach and local expertise to help customers navigate customs processes, and seamlessly coordinate their supply chains, ensuring the timely movement of goods.*

*To work at Maersk Customs Services is to work with the world. With over 60,000 unique customers, actively trading in 139 countries worldwide with a global delivery network spread across 113 countries, you will be working in a truly international environment.*

*Our end-to-end logistics services is constantly improving and with that our growing suite of digital solutions as well, which you can use to your benefit as part of our team in Customs Services.*

*Find yourself welcome in our diverse and inclusive culture, working alongside a team of more than 2,200 trade and customs experts around the world, where you are valued for who you are and rewarded for what you bring.*

*Are you ready to play your part in this?*


Customs Integration Engineer

*Working at Maersk Customs Services (MCS) means working in an international environment together with passionate and highly competent colleagues. With a strong drive to generate sustainable solutions, we facilitate international trade and help our customers to grow their business. The willingness to get engaged in this important task is clear proof of the pride and commitment felt by everyone throughout the company.*

**We Offer**


Maersk Customs Services is growing, and we are therefore looking for new colleagues with a passion for creating business value for our customers. The Solution and Design Engineering team is looking for a **Customs Integration Engineer** with a focus on establishing integration solutions with our customers and partners. You will play an integral role in recommending and implementing optimised integration solutions to simplify and improve the day to day execution of the business. The position will work together with colleagues in projects and will take responsibility for the information flow to and from our production systems. This work includes data analysis, mapping specification, integration configurations, ques and webservices, mapping between formats in our integration platform and similar work in the end-to-end information process. You will be hosting data analysis workshops and document the requirements and specifications.


You will be part of a team that are experts in system design, configuration and B2B integrations within the customs area. The team is responsible for designing and configuring solutions for automation of customs processes. We also work with improving operational processes, change management and educating our customers in how to use the solutions.

*If you are a driven team player, with experience from data analysis, B2B integrations and project management and are stimulated by working in an exciting industry in the middle of the digitalization journey, this is the role for you!*

*You will join a technology driven organization where your contribution makes a difference.* Our organization is characterized by freedom under responsibility, where your initiatives and contributions are acknowledged and make a difference. At MCS, you are given good opportunities for personal development. We value a good work-life balance, and we care about the health of our employees.


The Customer Solutions Engineers will report to the Head of Solution and Design Engineering Customs Europe and be part of a distributed team dedicated to planning, designing, and implementing digital solutions.

**Key Responsibilities**


In the role of Customs Integration Engineer you will have the opportunity to work with the following areas, depending on the focus of your role:

* Business Process Analysis and Design:


You will analyze the business processes, define tools to use and design the most suitable solution together with experts within the team.

* Information and Data Analysis, holding workshops with the customers and our internal operational departments, documenting the results
* Systems Design and Configuration:


You will design and configure the integrations and digital systems to enable service delivery to the customers, ensure that tests are completed and that the solution is quality assured.

* Technical Project Management:


Responsible for planning, communicating, delivering value to the customer in smaller to medium projects, managing scope, drive tests, produce documentation and balancing time, budget and quality

* Manage Improvements for our existing customers:


Responsible for planning, communicating, delivering change requests and necessary improvements to the existing solutions for our customers.

**We’re looking for**


To us, your personality is of great importance, and we value qualities such as curiosity, flexibility and ability to collaborate.


To be successful in the role of Customs Integration Engineer, we also believe you bring some of the following experiences and competencies:

* Academic education within IT or relevant field.
* Experience in customs, logistics and trade industry
* 2-5 years of relevant experience in a customer focused role.
* Experience from working with B2B Integration and Data Analysis
* Experience from working with configuration of technical solutions integrated within a complex environment.
* Experience from working with Implementation projects.
* Experience from analyzing and aligning services with business processes.
* Excellent communicator.
* 3 years of relevant experience as Technical Project Manager within IT.
* Knowledge withing the area of Change Management
* It is a merit if you have experiences from business intelligence, IT infrastructure, IT security or user experience and design (UX)
* Professional working proficiency in English, written and oral.


The selection process in ongoing, but we would like to receive your resume as soon as possible. We welcome your application!


Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

  

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

title: UX Designer
description:
**Description**
**Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights, TUI, etc.**
**Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 2600 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Canada, Greece, India, Uruguay and Poland.
   

  

 The role**
 As a UX Designer at Etraveli Group, you'll get the opportunity to push for innovation and develop new ways of working in an agile and flexible environment
   

  

 With an iterative mindset, you get to try, test and try again to learn and always continue to develop both yourself and the products. You will create beautifully crafted experiences for our customers across platforms based on user insights and business requirements. You do this in multi-disciplinary teams, together with product owners, developers, testers, and analysts.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a passionate UX designer who thrives on empathy and curiosity. You understand that great design begins with a deep understanding of the user’s needs, and you constantly seek out new perspectives to inform your work. Communication is your superpower—you can clearly articulate your ideas and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to bring those ideas to life. Adaptability is second nature to you; you embrace feedback, learn from it, and continuously evolve your designs. Above all, you are a storyteller, able to craft compelling narratives that resonate with users and stakeholders alike, driving meaningful user experiences that make a lasting impact.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

* Work as a UX designer in one of our product teams, where you will design the travel experience for our customers; before, during and after their trip. You will also drive the sales of additional products like baggage and seating. Your role will be essential in balancing customer support with business growth.
* Work in all parts of the UX process. From problem discovery, research to ideation, concept development, interaction design, prototyping and validation.
* Meet with customers, observe their needs and translate the insights into actions that continuously create value for them, the business, and the company.


**Requirements**
* A few years of proven UX design experience within the e-commerce sector, working with both web and mobile solutions—Travel Industry experience is a plus!
* Relevant training in UX, HCI, cognitive science or a similar field.
* Experience working in all steps of the UX process, from discovery and ideation to prototyping and validation.
* Proficiency with Figma and working with component-based libraries and design systems.
* Experience working with agile methods in cross-functional teams.
* Experience in front-end development, digital design and/or CRO is a big plus.
* Κnowledge of accessibility best practices (e.g., WCAG).
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
* A strong portfolio showcasing your past work in all phases of the UX process.


**Benefits**
 Working at Etraveli Group means working at a fast-growing company with high ambitions of becoming the number one Online travel agency worldwide. The culture at the company embraces complexity and we like to keep the entrepreneurial spirit even as we grow into being a larger company. You will have awesome colleagues with whom you will have fun solving complex problems in a fast-moving business.
   

  

**We Also Offer**
* A flexible working environment. We work on a hybrid-model where you can choose to work two days from home and you will have two weeks per year that you can choose to work from a remote location
* Central office location in both Gothenburg and Stockholm
* Healthcare allowance – Each employee receives a maximum allowable amount each year according to the Swedish Tax Agency to spend on health-promoting activities such as a gym card, massage etc.
* Pension and health insurance – Through partners we offer a comprehensive pension and health insurance so that you can get help quickly in case of an accident
* Enjoy a vibrant company culture with daily office breakfasts, a weekly fika club, a ping pong table for friendly matches, and exciting events like our summer mingle and Christmas party.


 As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.
   

  

 At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds. During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.
   

  

 Welcome to Etraveli Group!

title: Graphic Design Intern
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
**Role**
 As a Design Intern, you will support our commercial initiatives across both online and offline channels, contributing to the design and layout of marketing materials, tenders, and presentations. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience and work alongside our Senior Designer on a variety of projects and play a key role in enhancing our visual communications, ensuring that our brand is represented with consistency and creativity. To put it into specifics you will:
   

  

* Support the design and layout of tender documents and other commercial proposals.
* Create and edit presentations, especially in Google Slides, ensuring alignment with brand standards.
* Assist in designing visual assets for both online and offline marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with the commercial team to produce digital and print materials, including stickers, hangers, social media assets, and brochures.
* Work within established brand guidelines to ensure cohesive and professional visual communication.
* Participate in brainstorming and creative sessions to contribute ideas and feedback.


**What You Need To Embark**
 We’re looking for a collaborative and curious Design Intern who is currently studying Graphic Design or a related field. In addition to being fluent in English we believe the right person has:
   

  

* Experience in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides) and Figma.
* Understanding of graphic design principles, typography, and colour theory.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
* Attention to details.


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: UX-designer
description:
**Välkommen till en grön värld av möjligheter hos oss på Sveaskog. Vi erbjuder dig skogen – en vacker arbetsplats och framför allt ett av våra viktigaste bidrag för att klara utmaningar kopplade till klimatförändringar och framtidens råvaruförsörjning. Nu söker vi dig som är teamorienterad och vill vara med oss på resan.**
**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Att arbeta på Sveaskog innebär stor frihet samtidigt som du förväntas ta ansvar, visa mod och vara nyfiken. I allas uppdrag ingår att ta ansvar för sin egen och verksamhetens utveckling samt att vara teamorienterad och en bra kollega. Vi kallar det aktivt medarbetarskap. Vi erbjuder dig attraktiva förmåner och en arbetsplats som kännetecknas av en vilja att du ska lyckas, där jämställdhet och hållbart arbetsliv står högt på agendan. Sveaskog eftersträvar mångfald och en jämn könsfördelning inom alla yrken i företaget.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Design-teamet befinner sig på en spännande resa och nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och driva utvecklingen av vårt designarbete och stärka användarupplevelsen inom UI/UX-design. I den här rollen får du förbättra kund- och användarupplevelsen, öka kunskapen om designprocesser och design thinking samt säkerställa en enhetlig design tillsammans med våra leverantörer.
   

  

 Du fungerar som länken mellan användare och utvecklingsteam, kvalitetssäkrar designleveranser och skapar prototyper, wireframes och mockups utifrån organisationens behov. Vi ser gärna att du tycker det är roligt att utbilda och inspirera andra, samtidigt som du hittar kreativa och kostnadseffektiva lösningar med fokus på UI.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som vill utvecklas i ditt arbete, vara en del av ett prestigelöst och engagerat företag samt bidra till en grön värld. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som har ett starkt öga för detaljer, som är nyfiken och vill göra skillnad – både för användarna och för Sveaskog.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har nedanstående eller motsvarande förmåga:
   

  

* Du har relevant utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom design.
* Har god erfarenhet av att leda arbete i grupp, driva UX-processer och arbeta med tillgänglighetsramverk som WCAG.
* Du har en stark grafisk profil med bred erfarenhet av UI och kan visa upp en portfolio från tidigare projekt.
* Förstår systemutveckling och trivs med agila arbetssätt.
* Är kundorienterad, drivande och kreativ, med en förmåga att sätta dig in i olika verksamhetsområden.
* Du är en god kommunikatör i tal och skrift och har förmåga att skapa och upprätthålla goda relationer.


 Stationering på något utav Sveaskogs nordliga kontor, förslagsvis: Umeå, Luleå, Kalix, Östersund, Karlstad, Piteå och Lycksele.
   

  

**Vill du växa med oss?**
 Den här rekryteringen genomförs i samarbete med Forefront Amplify på uppdrag av Sveaskog.
   

  

**Ansökan sker via formuläret här**
 Har du frågor? Kontakta Malva Svensson, ansvarig rekryterare, via malva.svensson@forefront.se
   

  

 Fackliga kontaktpersoner är för Ledarna Thomas Esbjörnsson, tel 010-544 99 75, för Akademikerföreningen Sara Östh, tel 010-544 97 11 och för Unionen Stig Sjöberg 08-655 90 58.
   

  

**Om Sveaskog**
 Sveaskog är Sveriges största skogsägare och ägs av svenska staten. Bolaget äger 14 procent av Sveriges skogsmarker och har cirka 800 medarbetare runt om i landet. Våra kontor finns från Tärendö i norr till Osby i söder.

title: Service Designer
description:
*RaySearch develops innovative software solutions to improve cancer care. About 1000 clinics in more than 40 countries use RaySearch software to improve treatments and quality of life for patients. RaySearch was founded in 2000 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. The headquarters is located in Stockholm, with subsidiaries in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia & New Zealand. Today we are more than 400 employees with a common vision of improving cancer care with innovative software. Our great staff is crucial for our success and we offer a fantastic working environment in modern offices, flexibility and good opportunities for development. We believe in equal opportunities, value diversity and work actively to prevent discrimination.*
 The UX team is growing and we are now looking for a Service Designer with a strong focus on UX & UI Design—someone who can work across the full spectrum of service design, from high-level system thinking to detailed interaction flows and UI components. If you are passionate about turning complexity into clarity and designing seamless user experiences in healthcare, this is your chance to make a difference.
   

  

 This is an opportunity to work at the intersection of UX, strategy, and healthcare innovation. As a Service Designer at RaySearch Laboratories, you will shape the future of oncology software, from hospital-wide systems to detailed UI components. You will apply design thinking at multiple levels, from big-picture strategy to detailed UI interactions, and be part of a strong UX team that values both usability and visual design. If you want to work in a highly impactful industry, improving how clinicians fight cancer, this role is for you.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Service Designer at RaySearch Laboratories, you will work at both a strategic and operational level, shaping the way our oncology software supports clinicians and hospitals worldwide. You will be responsible for mapping end-to-end service ecosystems, designing user interactions at different levels, and ensuring that our solutions meet real-world clinical needs.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a complex and regulated domain and is comfortable navigating both the big picture and the fine details—from conceptualizing hospital-wide oncology information systems to designing precise UI components and workflows for clinicians.
   

  

 You will be part of a collaborative, cross-functional team of UX designers, clinical specialists, developers, and product managers, working towards a harmonized user experience across multiple products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Product & Service Design
+ Design workflows and UI for complex healthcare systems, ensuring smooth integration across services and roles.
+ Create blueprints, user journeys, and modular solutions that scale across hospital environments.
+ Identify gaps and propose innovative improvements based on user insights and system-level thinking.


**UX Design & Prototyping**
* Translate concepts into intuitive, testable experiences through user flows and prototypes.
* Collaborate with clinicians and stakeholders to define and validate role-specific interactions.
* Evolve UI components in alignment with our design system and real-world use.


**Cross-functional Collaboration**
* Work closely with developers, product managers, and regulatory teams to ensure quality and compliance.
* Drive co-creation and ensure research insights lead to actionable product improvements.
* Promote user-centered methods and align teams around shared design goals.


**What You´ll Bring** 
  

  

* Experience & Expertise
+ 7+ years in UX and service design, with a strong portfolio showing both strategy and craft.
+ Proven ability to design at system level and down to detailed UI and workflow interactions.


  

  

* Tools & Methods
+ Proficient in Figma, prototyping, and data-driven UX processes.
+ Experience with user research and testing tools.


  

  

* Mindset
+ Strategic yet hands-on—drives progress while keeping sight of the bigger picture.
+ Curious, collaborative and impact-driven—passionate about improving healthcare outcomes.


  

  

* Meriting
+ Experience from regulated domains like healthcare, medtech or finance.
+ Interest in AI-powered design and scalable design solutions.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySearch is the driving force behind our organization, where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems - no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply for the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: Grafisk designer - LIA/praktik
description:
**Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla.**
 Om rollen & teamet
   

  

 Vi söker dig som älskar att skapa visuellt säljande material, vare sig det är till ett nyhetsbrev eller en annons på Instagram. Du är är full av driv och har en vilja att lära dig allt som krävs för att bli en riktigt vass grafisk designer. Som grafisk designer på Apohem blir du en del av Brand-teamet och hela marknadsavdelningen. Du får möjlighet att vara delaktig i vårt dagliga arbete och lära dig massor av nytt. Du blir samtidigt en viktig del i att lyfta Apohems visuella uttryck till nya nivåer.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen är du en person med öga för detaljer och som hjälper till där det behövs. Ditt fokus är på produktion och att bli självgående i Adobe Suite, men du är inte heller rädd att komma med egna idéer och initiativ. Det är viktigt att du kan jobba självständigt, även om du kommer få stöttning av vårt designteam.
   

  

 Du kommer göra det här (och säkert mer):
   

  

* Producera content och material (rörligt, stillbild) till våra digitala kanaler såsom webb, sociala medier och e-mail
* Jobba med kreativa koncept och kampanjer som tas ut i våra kanaler
* Producera Ai-material som linjerar med Apohems varumärke
* Fotografera produkter till våra olika kanaler tillsammans med vår grafiska designer


**Du Får**
* Nära stöttning och handledning av vårt designteam (Grafisk designer och Art Director & Motion Creative)
* En inblick hur det är att jobba på en marknadsavdelning, på en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-commerce företag


**Vi Vill Att Du**
* Studerar grafisk design och har en praktik/LIA period.
* Har jobbat i Adobe Suite tidigare (Framförallt Photoshop, Illustrator och After Effects), men vårt designteam finns alltid där för att stötta dig.
* Är en ‘doer’ och van att hålla ett högt tempo med många bollar i luften.
* Är bra på att både ge/ta feedback.
* Är prestigelös och redo att ta dig an vad som helst.
* Är initiativtagande och ser möjligheter snarare än problem.
* Är nyfiken och hungrig på att lära dig nya saker.
* Är kreativ och har ett öga för detaljer


 Att jobba på Apohem
   

  

 Som Sveriges snabbast växande apotek med snart en miljard i omsättning och hundratals medarbetare är det längesedan vi var en start-up. Även om vi såklart har våra processer och riktlinjer, skulle vi aldrig någonsin låta oss fastna i byråkrati som andra storbolag. Vi har vårt startup-mindset kvar, är alltid hungriga och vill snabbt framåt.
   

  

 Den snabba tillväxten vi har kräver djärva medarbetare som tar modiga beslut, som vill göra saker bättre och inte räds förändringar. Hos oss är varje person sin egen ledare och tar ansvar för att utveckla både sig själv, sitt område och Apohem. Men vi gör alla samma resa – vi gör det ihop. Och det råder inga som helst frågetecken kring vart vi är på väg. Det är nästan så att man blir otålig. Tillsammans har vi byggt Apohem på de fundamenten – en arbetsplats där vi vinner tillsammans, vet vart vi ska och alltid är taggade!
   

  

 Låter det spännande?
   

  

 Sök nu! Praktikperioden börjar så snart som möjligt under våren 2025 med hänsyn till din utbildningsplan och varar minst 8 veckor. Sista ansökningsdag 2025-04-30.
   

  

 Om Apohem
   

  

 Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla. Det ska inte vara dyrt eller krångligt att ta hand om sig själv och dem man tycker om. Därför erbjuder vi över 20 000 handplockade produkter, tillsammans med inspiration, vägledning och personlig rådgivning från farmaceuter, hudterapeuter och kundrådgivare.
   

  

 Apohem ingår i Axel Johnson-koncernen och är sedan 2019 ett fullskaligt apotek. Apohem är för tredje året i rad en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-handlare och Sveriges snabbast växande apotek.
   

  

 Apohem är en utmanare i apoteksbranschen som vill göra apotek, hälsa och skönhet tillgängligt för alla. Det ska inte vara dyrt eller krångligt att ta hand om sig själv och dem man tycker om. Därför erbjuder vi över 20 000 handplockade produkter, tillsammans med inspiration, vägledning och personlig rådgivning från farmaceuter, hudterapeuter och kundrådgivare.
   

  

 Apohem ingår i Axel Johnson-koncernen och är sedan 2019 ett fullskaligt apotek. Apohem är för tredje året i rad en av Sveriges snabbast växande e-handlare och Sveriges snabbast växande apotek.

title: UX Artist - Games
description:
As a UX artist at Embark, your job is to enable amazing user experiences for our gamers, experiences that they will remember and talk about for decades. Here you will work closely together with other talents to create everything from 2D elements, branding material, HUD, to living and inviting scenes with 3D components.
   

  

 If you like to spend time thinking about how players explore and experience games, and perhaps you also imagine a future where players can be part of creating their own unique experiences, then Embark might be your future home.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with a wide range of talents at Embark to deliver a great user experience
* Create aesthetically delightful visuals that enhances the gameplay experience
* Evaluating different software, techniques, engines and pipelines and help us get better and change how we work in the future


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* Minimum 3 years of relevant professional art experience
* A strong passion for art, design and games
* Excellent visual skillset and deep artistic understanding and knowledge
* Experience of following directions and deliver to quality from a visual, game play and technical perspective
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Sportsbook - Design Manager
description:
Looking for
 

 your next challenge?
 

 Betsson
 

 Sportsbook is now hiring!
 


  
 



  

**About the role** 
  



 As a Product Design Manager at Betsson you lead, mentor and facilitate, you will be responsible for a team of Product Designers. Together with the Head of Design and your team you’ll ensure the delivery of top-notch user-centric UI/UX for our Sportsbook Product. Your contributions will play a critical role in the overall success of the Sportsbook Product.
 

  
 



  



 You strive to constantly elevate our product by creating compelling, useful, engaging user interfaces, and experiences. Rooted in user data and in collaboration with both the business and tech side, you’ll together with your team explore and execute different design approaches, to aid specific user needs and compliance regulations on our various markets. All to ensure that the product flows logically and looks beautifully on any device or market across multiple brands serving millions of customers. 
 

  
 



  

**About us** 
  




 The
 

 Betsson
 

 Group’s mission is to put customers at the heart of our business through unrivalled customer experiences, and you will play a crucial part in achieving that mission. Our Sportsbook Platform is ours and developed in-house – from the Architecture to our Trading teams – we have an in-house platform which hosts our brands offering Sports betting for our customers. 
 


  
 



  

**Your responsibilities** 
  

  
* You
 

 facilitate
 

 growth and effective processes for your team
  
* You assume ownership and advocate proactively for improved UI/UX solutions to ensure our iGaming product is not only up to date, but market leading
  
* Together with your team you solve customer pain points where UI/UX improvements are based on data and user insights
  
* You collaborate closely with the Head of Design, other designers, research, product owners, stakeholders, QA, and developers.
 

 You’ll
 

 ensure effective ways of working for your team, strive for excellence while showing enthusiasm in a fast-paced ever evolving fun and supporting environment
  
* You
 

 maintain
 

 and develop our Design System in collaboration with your team to secure consistency and a
 

 state of the art
 

 design language throughout our product
  


  

**What you bring** 
  

  
* Ability to clearly communicate and demonstrate new workflows, solutions and ideas to the rest of the design team, stakeholders, and multidisciplinary team(s)
  
* Passionate about learning and educating people in your team and the company about design values
  
* You foster empathy, an ability to put other people’s interests first
  
* Proven knowledge about
 

 maintaining
 

 a mature Design System
  
* Extensive experience creating visually pleasing and interactive prototypes through industry standard software such as Figma or similar
  
* Experience as a Product Designer but also experience of successfully leading other Product Designers for complex digital products
  
* It would be considered an asset if you have experience working in the iGaming industry and if you have a genuine interest in Sports / Sports betting
  


  

 Where you'll be
   


 At Betsson Group we work with a Hybrid Work From Home (WFH) model, giving you the flexibility of working 3 days in the office and 2 days at home.
 


  

 What We Offer
   

  
* Monthly Allowance for Lunch
  
* Private & Life Plan Insurance for you and your family
  
* Team Building Budget
  
* Annual Wellness Allowance
  
* Corporate Travel Insurance
  
* Events and initiatives both Local (Quarterly Meetings) and Global
  
* Professional Development Programs & Internal Career Opportunities
  
* Milestone Birthday
  


  



 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1900 strong, spread across 7 offices! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 

  
 



  



 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of a multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 

  
 



  


**Challenge Accepted?** 



  


***Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about.***



  


***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our***
***Privacy Policy***

title: SEO Specialist
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Join Us as Our SEO Specialist (Parental Leave Cover – 12+ Months)**
**Hello SEO enthusiasts!**
 We're on the lookout for a talented, tech-savvy SEO Specialist to join our Digital Sales & Media Performance team for a minimum 12-month parental leave cover. This is a fantastic opportunity to make a real impact and shape our organic performance during a transformative time for our new Digital department.
   

  

 I'm Elin Melin Lundström, Head of Digital Sales & Media Performance. Together, we’re building a forward-thinking team, and we need someone like you—skilled in technical SEO, content strategy, and keyword research—to help us continue our journey toward digital excellence.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As our SEO Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of optimizing our digital presence. You'll work hands-on with technical optimization, content strategy, and keyword research, improving everything from site speed and structure to organic search visibility and user experience.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with developers, UX designers, content creators, and web analysts to drive meaningful results. Whether it’s a deep-dive audit or implementing SEO best practices across sites, your work will ensure we stay ahead in the ever-evolving search landscape.
   

  

 We’re also curious about emerging areas like Answer Engine Optimization (AEO)—if you're excited about structured data, featured snippets, and optimizing for AI-driven search experiences, you’ll feel right at home.
   

  

 This is a parental leave cover for at least 12 months, with the possibility to extend.
   

  

**🛠 What You’ll Do:**
* Shape and execute SEO strategies focused on organic growth.
* Lead technical SEO efforts—crawlability, indexability, performance optimization.
* Conduct keyword research and support content strategy development.
* Guide on-page optimization to drive traffic and improve rankings.
* Explore and contribute to initiatives in Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) and structured data markup.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align SEO with broader digital goals.
* Monitor search performance and identify areas for improvement.
* Stay ahead of search engine algorithm updates and industry trends.


**What We’re Looking For:**
* SEO Strategist: Proven experience crafting successful SEO strategies.
* Tech-Savvy: Hands-on experience with tools like Google Search Console, GA4, Ahrefs, SEMrush, or similar.
* Code Confident: Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for SEO-related optimizations.
* Keyword Expert: Strong research skills and ability to translate findings into actionable content plans.
* AEO Curious: Interest or experience in Answer Engine Optimization, featured snippets, and schema markup is a plus.
* Collaborative Communicator: Able to translate SEO concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Analytical Thinker: Data-driven and detail-oriented with a knack for solving SEO challenges.
* Project Juggler: Comfortable managing multiple SEO initiatives in a fast-paced environment.
* Self-Starter: Strong ability to plan, prioritize, and structure your own work to meet deadlines and goals.
* In-House Experience: Experience working in-house with SEO is meriting, especially in close collaboration with cross-functional teams.
* Curious Learner: Passionate about staying updated on best practices and emerging SEO trends.


 Ready to step in and make your mark during an exciting period of growth?
   

  

 Apply now and help us keep the SEO momentum strong while our current specialist is on parental leave! Let’s shape our digital future—together.
   

  

**It’s more than just a job!**
 Regardless of the position you are looking for, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both as a professional and as a person, with us. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. We respect and value the diversity of people. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact me at elin.melin-lundstrom@teliacompany.com.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Background checks are part of our recruitment process.
   

  

**Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!**

title: Product Manager - Connected Energy Management
description:
Eaton offers a dynamic, supportive, and inclusive environment that values your skills, your drive, and your hunger for success. You'll be at the forefront of creating solutions that help businesses and communities manage their power more intelligently, safely, and sustainably. Joining Eaton means you're not just developing or selling products – together we create a brighter, more efficient, and sustainable future.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As Product Manager you will be responsible for managing our Controller and Software offering in Connected Energy Management domain throughout the entire product life cycle and for all product relevant issues (features, cost, footprint, price positioning) in EMEA region. You will define and pursue relevant business goals in support of Eaton's strategic direction and energy transition growth initiatives. Furthermore, you are responsible for end-to-end profitability and for acting as the technical expert for the relevant product portfolio of Connected Energy Management Devices and related accessories. We are considering candidates from Hungary, Czechia, Germany, Austria, the Netherlands and the Nordics too who can be based in local Eaton sites.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Execute product strategy and define product roadmap for the Connected Energy Management Controllers and Software offering.
* Understand and identify customer needs and EMEA competitive environment as well as market trends of products and applications.
* Drive new product development jointly with Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Quality and Business Development functions.
* Manage communication around commercial, product, application and market aspects to key internal and external stakeholders.
* Ensure compliance of relevant products with standards, cybersecurity requirements, and Intellectual Property policies and approve final documentation
* Act as Level 3 Technical Support
* Act as a SCRUM Team Product Owner - lead and direct a cross functional project team toward fulfilment of technical & commercial product development targets.
* Driving resolution of product quality issues and supporting supply chain and logistics product topics.
* Maintain existing products and supporting new product market launch (marketing material, catalogue maintenance, product data management,
* Manage product obsolescence and market phase-out activities.


**Qualifications**
 Essential Qualifications:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related technical field). An MBA or other advanced degree is a plus.
* 5+ years of experience in product management, preferably in the IoT, smart home, power distribution or related technology sectors.
* Knowledge of power distribution systems and components, including DIN rail mounted devices (circuit breakers, relays, contactors), metering equipment, and control components.
* Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum).
* Knowledge of consumer and building communication protocols (e.g., Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, Z-Wave, MQTT, KNX, Modbus TCP, and Matter)
* Demonstrated understanding of UI/UX design principles and best practices. Experience working with UX designers and researchers.
* Ability to translate user needs into compelling user experiences. Experience with design thinking methodologies.
* Strong understanding of interoperability principles and best practices. Experience with API design and integration.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and mobile app development (iOS and Android).
* Experience with specific home automation platforms or ecosystems (e.g., Google Home, Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit).
* Knowledge of energy-related regulations and standards.
* Experience with electrical engineering principles and practices.
* Familiarity with electrical safety standards and regulations.


**What We Offer You**
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Permanent contract in a fast-growing global company
* Challenging projects in dynamic collaborative team
* Flexible working solutions (working hours & home office eligibility)
* We make your aspirations matter – Eaton encourages internal promotion, whenever possible and we make your growth matter
* We invest in our employees for the long term – not just with salary and benefits, but with ongoing learning and development opportunities made available through Eaton University
* We make your contributions matter - reliability, safety, efficiency, and sustainability are at the core of our dedication to improving people’s lives and the environment through power management technologies.


 We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.
   

  

 ]]>

title: Enterprise Solution Architect
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Do you want to be part of a team designing the architecture for Ericsson’s digital transformation? At Ericsson, we've identified a set of digital capabilities tied together in different customer and employee journeys. We aim to improve our customers’ experience and end-to-end workflow efficiency by using data, new innovative ways of working, and fit-for-purpose modern technology.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Solution Architect you will work in an agile team and be responsible for the design and blueprinting architecture, realized by internal software engineers or external vendors. You would be responsible for continuously matching business requirements, aligned with perspectives from business process, information architecture, data architecture and IT architecture along with focus on the functionality aspects. You are entrusted with creating business value, by balancing the functional requirements against other non-functional/quality requirements, by evaluating necessary priorities and compromises, while defining the best fit solution.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Ensure alignment with our target architecture and security directives, ranging from integration patterns to buy/build recommendations, guiding and steering agile development teams with architecture guardrails and advice.
* Present solution architecture to formal review boards when applicable.
* Influence and share architectural good practices within Group IT and across Ericsson.
* Be working in close collaboration with Product Owners, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, Service designers, UX designers, Software Engineers, Business SME's, Agile Coaches etc. as well as peer architect roles including Enterprise-, Security-, Business- and Information Architects.
* Be an ambassador for enterprise architecture and an active contributor in internal and external architecture communities.


**Skills You Bring**
* An understanding of how to build and implement full-stack enterprise-grade web and mobile solutions (cloud native, containers, public cloud PaaS services, security built-in, API first design etc.) as well as integration with Commercial-off-the-shelf and Software-as-a-Service solutions.
* Ability to collaborate with a diverse team of people from different backgrounds, field of expertise, level of seniority across different parts of the world.
* A genuine interest in technology, eager to learn and keep up with the latest trends like AI/ML, automation and public cloud.
* Well versed with Enterprise Architecture Modelling tools (such as LeanIX, ARIS, Sparx, Archi, etc.)
* Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks (such as TOGAF, Zachman, etc.)
* An Agile and experimentation mindset – where you would take informed decision quickly, seek feedback actively and adjust decisively.


**Nice to have**
* A background designing digital solutions for either Supply & Logistics, Sourcing, Finance/ERP, Telecom Network Roll-out or customer journey workflows in a B2B scenario.
* Expertise in digital contract platforms (e.g., DocuSign, Adobe Sign, CLM).
* Experience with leading CPQ platforms (e.g., Salesforce CPQ, Oracle CPQ).
* Strong in Supply Chain Planning and Integrated Business Planning.
* Knowledge/experience in BMC Helix, SuccessFactors, SAP S/4 systems
* Knowledge of integration patterns, data management and workflow automation.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Khalid Cruz]]
