* Experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps for CI/CD
* Understanding of governance, compliance, and security best practices within SharePoint environments
* Proficiency in Swedish is a big plus

title: Operational Services Sales – Intern
description:
Operational Services Sales – Intern  


This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.**Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

 **Who We Are:**


At HPE, our team members search beyond customers' needs today to accelerate what’s next and make a difference for others, our company, and the planet. Our customers turn to us because we are positive, empathetic, and enterprising. We embrace opportunities to accelerate this transformation across data, connectivity, cloud, and security. And together we make what was once thought impossible, possible.


That’s why we not only give you the space to grow into the professional you want to be, but we also embrace who you are and where you come from. We also value the flexibility and autonomy to balance work and personal needs in a way that works best for you.


As an Inside OS Sales Representative, you will play a crucial role in supporting our internal sales and driving the growth of HPE Services in Sweden. You will work closely with our Account and Hardware sales teams to ensure the successful promotion and sale of our services.


This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your sales skills and grow within the organization. If you are passionate about sales and eager to contribute to our success, we would love to hear from you!

**Start date**: September 2025

**What you'll do:**

* **Support OS Sales Activities:** Assist in the development and execution of internal sales strategies to achieve growth objectives.
* **Sales Coordination:** Collaborate with the sales team to grow HPE Services in HPE hardware business on your Accounts, coordinate internal activities and campaigns, and follow-up to drive demand and uncover growth opportunities.
* **Training and Development:** Participate in training sessions to enhance your knowledge of HPE products and services and support the alignment of sales teams and partners.
* **Market Analysis:** Conduct market and competitive analysis to identify trends and opportunities for growth in your Accounts.
* **Business & Sales Planning:** Contribute to the development of Account plans to ensure HPE Services growth.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with various HPE teams, to align strategies, share best practices, and encourage a collaborative environment in your common Accounts.
* **Cross-Functional Coordination:** Facilitate communication and coordination between different departments to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives on your Accounts.

**What you’ll need:**

* **Pursuing Bachelor’s/Master’s degree** with a focus in business, economics, or related.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in **Swedish and English**
* Experience or a proven interest in sales and a passion for technology
* Excellent at building relationships at all levels and having solution-focused discussions

**What we’d prefer you bring:**

* The drive to seek out what’s next and to deliver exceptional results
* A collaborative, solution-focused spirit and overall sense of urgency
* The desire to embrace new ideas and fresh thinking and seek out ideas different than your own
* Experience as an active leader on campus who strives to make a positive impact on the world
* Comfort with working in a hybrid (virtual and face-to-face) environment
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills and the ability to ask smart questions

**At HPE, we’re:**

* Ranked 19th on Fortune’s 2022 list of 100 Best Companies to Work For.
* Ranked 7th on Newsweek’s list of America’s Most Responsible Companies 2022
* Named a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion for the sixth year in row
* Named one of the 100 Best Large Workplaces for Millennials in 2021
* Recognized as one of the Best Companies for Multicultural Women by Seramount

**Additional Skills:**


Accountability, Accountability, Action Planning, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Bias, Business, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Group Problem Solving, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Office Administration, Policy and procedures, Recordkeeping, Risk Assessment, Service And Support Planning {+ 6 more}**What We Can Offer You:**

**Health & Wellbeing**


We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal & Professional Development**


We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Unconditional Inclusion**


We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

**Let's Stay Connected:**


Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

title: Senior Product Engineer
description:
**About Us**
------------


Platform Engineering is reshaping how enterprises build and run their cloud-native setups, and Humanitec is leading this transformation. Our mission is to help teams build Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs) that unlock true developer self-service.


Through our community-driven initiatives, like platformengineering.org and PlatformCon, we are not just following the trend, but defining it. With a growing list of enterprise customers and skyrocketing IDP adoption, we are expanding our team.


This is where you come in.

**About the Role**
------------------


We are looking for a Senior Product/Software Engineer to help us scale our work to build and scale our category-defining Platform Orchestrator. As an Engineer, you will share ownership of how our products are built and evolve, contributing to both our short-term deliverables and long-term vision.


We work across a modern, diverse stack, including:

* Microservices (APIs) written in Go, running on Kubernetes
* Tests written in Go, Robot Framework, and more
* Web apps and VSCode extensions built with React and TypeScript
* CLI written in Go
* Emerging areas, including chat-based interfaces built on third-party LLMs


To thrive in this role, you must be comfortable with start-up life: shipping constantly, rolling up your sleeves to help debug customer issues, working on and contributing to a frequently evolving roadmap, and picking up work across our stack, with a focus on impact.


Humanitec is an all-remote company. Our small teams work closely to do big things. This is a fully remote position. Preferred time zones for this role are UTC-1 to UTC+3.

**What You Will Bring:**
------------------------

* **Excellent communication & collaboration:** You are comfortable working in a fully remote environment, working across GitHub, Notion, Slack, Jira, and more. You prioritize and protect your focus time, but don't hesitate to jump on a call when a situation demands it. You don’t offload communication or coordination to product/project managers – you own our work end-to-end.
* **Strong problem-solving and coding skills:** You value designing solutions to customer problems – from researching and defining use cases, to writing design documents, to implementing clean solutions that address them.
* **Hands-on experience with infrastructure:** whether you’ve been part of an on-call rotation or just working day-to-day observability tools, you are comfortable rolling up your sleeves to understand the factors at play in an incident or service degradation.
* **Pragmatism:** You are comfortable balancing “perfect” with “good enough,” as an individual and as part of a team.
* **Modern cloud experience:** You have built and run apps on Kubernetes on cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure. You are familiar with Docker, IaC (Terraform or OpenTofu), and modern CI/CD pipelines.
* **Bias to action:** You thrive in fast-paced, often ambiguous environments. You take initiative, use pragmatism when making decisions, and value progress over perfection.

**What You Will Do:**
---------------------

* **Contribute to our core product:** Engineering at Humanitec is a team sport. You’ll work across our stack - primarily in Go - on services that power our applications. (Experience working in Go is a plus, but not required.)
* **Design and refine technical systems:** You will share ownership of customer use cases and the systems that power them – microservices, customer interfaces, automated tests – and help shape them to remain scalable, reliable, and elegant as they evolve.
* **Collaborate closely across disciplines:** You will partner with colleagues across the organization to explore problems, prototype ideas, and iterate quickly.
* **Improve how we build:** We value thoughtful abstractions, clean interfaces, and solid testing. You will help to continuously evolve our engineering pratices.


If this sounds like a fit, we would love to hear from you!


Have questions before applying? Reach out to us at careers@humanitec.com

title: Senior Project Manager (Cloud Infrastructure Readiness (CIR) initiative)
description:
**Start****18-05-2025****Duration****7-9 months**
  
Emagine is looking for a Senior Project Manager to join the Cloud Infrastructure Readiness (CIR) initiative at one of our nordic banking clients.
  

  

**Start:** 19-maj-2025  

**End:** 31-dec-2025

**Location:** Stockholm 3 days onsite, 2 days remote)  

  

**FOR THIS ROLE THERE IS A MATRIX**  

  

**About the assignment:**


Emagine is looking for a Senior Project Manager to join the Cloud Infrastructure Readiness (CIR) initiative. The role is part of client’s broader Cloud Transformation journey, focusing on the implementation and governance of technical capabilities within the bank’s cloud platforms – primarily Google Cloud Platform.


The role is not about building from scratch but about taking over, structuring, and further developing what is already in place. You will coordinate several active workstreams delivering capabilities that are essential to client’s multi-cloud strategy, ensuring alignment, delivery, and follow-up in a complex, cross-domain setup.

  

This role is more implementation-focused than strategic – we are looking for a hands-on project manager who thrives in execution and follow-through rather than high-level planning.

 **Requirements:**

* **Previous banking experience**
* Proven skill to drive major projects to successful implementation
* Able to bring structure and direction to complex initiatives involving multiple streams.
* Keeps stakeholders aligned and ensures progress toward delivery milestones in shifting and sometimes unclear contexts.
* Handle both high-level management and technical development teams, including managing conflicts of interest
* Skilled in identifying potential tension points and navigating them constructively.
* Able to raise the right issues to the right stakeholders at the right time.
* Ability to package and present complex matters to make them understandable and actionable
* Strategic mindset with the ability to break down complexity, ask the right questions, and communicate clearly across different levels of the organization.
* Highly structured and able to set robust frameworks that improve clarity, collaboration, and support progress
* Brings order to cross-functional delivery by aligning streams and enabling transparency across the program.
* Change leadership skills and experience in working with agile development methods
* Understands agile ways of working without expecting a fully defined team structure.
* Comfortable operating as a stand-alone project manager in an evolving setting where not everything is pre-defined or stable.
* Competence and experience of working with traditional infrastructural **IT and Cloud-based IT, preferably Cloud transformation**
* More important than deep cloud expertise is experience working in large, regulated organizations with slow-moving processes – someone who can maintain momentum in a banking context, rather than a fast-paced startup.

 **Preferred soft skills to be successful in the role**


The ideal candidate is a driven and proactive leader who inspires progress and ensures delivery without direct authority. They are comfortable working in large, complex enterprise environments and bring an open and inclusive approach when engaging with stakeholders and team members. With a natural ability to navigate ambiguity and transformation, they remain composed when traditional IT structures are questioned and evolving. Independence, initiative, and the ability to quickly grasp what truly matters in a complex setting are key to thriving in this role.


  
Endi Dedic
Business Manager

title: Engineering Manager - Grafana Drilldown
description:
**About the role:**



We are looking for an Engineering Manager to join the Grafana Drilldown team. Our managers take an active role in creating a productive environment for our engineers; be it through removing blockers and impediments, facilitating cross-team collaboration and understanding, or by aiding the team in helping themselves by constantly improving and refining their working practices. You’ll be responsible for managing a team of distributed engineers working across a variety of systems and helping them to perform at their best.


**About the team:**



In Grafana Drilldown, our mission is to design and maintain intuitive, opinionated, queryless user experiences that empower users to quickly answer telemetry questions through simple point-and-click interactions. We currently support queryless exploration across Mimir/Prometheus, Loki, Tempo, and Pyroscope.


### **Requirements****:**


* **Empathy and transparency.** The core focus of the role is people. You'll coach, mentor, and support engineers in their growth. Champion a healthy team culture with psychological safety, autonomy, and accountability.
* **Drive project delivery.** You'll help the team define goals, set milestones, communicate timelines, and navigate dependencies. You may need to take on project management responsibilities to ensure smooth and predictable delivery.
* **Technical background.** While you won’t be hands-on coding, your strong engineering background enables you to engage in meaningful technical discussions, ask the right questions, and support sound decision-making.
* **Support autonomy.** Our engineers take pride in owning both the technical and product aspects of their work. You are comfortable working with engineering teams who have a strong sense of autonomy in their decision making, be it technical or product focussed.
* **Build product intuition.** You’ll collaborate closely with some excellent Product Managers and Product Designers. We’re building a product *for engineers, by engineers*. So, you should feel comfortable developing a strong product sense and use our products in anger to develop empathy for the user.
* **Stay informed.** While you’re great with people and adept at managing relationships, you still keep up-to-date with the latest technical trends and shifts in order to maintain and enhance your understanding of the challenges your teams face.
* **Understand our stack.** While deep expertise in our exact tools isn’t required, familiarity with frontend frameworks (especially TypeScript/React), backend development in Go, and tools like GitHub, Prometheus, Loki, Tempo, and Pyroscope will help you ramp up quickly and speak your team’s language.

### **Your day-to-day will include****:**


* Regular 1:1s to ensure your direct reports are motivated, happy, and engaged.
* We coach, mentor, and advise. Upwards, sideways, and every-which-ways.
* Progress over Perfection. We provide continuous feedback to engineers to ensure that they can add value, while trying to maintain a high standard.
* Contributing to and reviewing design documents for upcoming features.
* Ensuring features are well-defined and ready for development.
* Advising your reports on how to break down features into tasks.
* Collaborating with our Engineering Leaders to help define and influence product strategy, roadmaps and technical designs.
* Maintaining headcount by working with our People Ops team to attract and hire talent.


In the Sweden, the Base compensation range for this role is SEK 836,741 - SEK 1,004,089. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.


* *Compensation ranges are country-specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*
  


**About Grafana Labs:** There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

**Benefits:**

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
company_description: Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, the leading open source software for visualizing time series data.

title: Technical Product Owner for the Cloud Tribe at SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with a technology function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you looking for a meaningful challenge and an opportunity to grow? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!* **About the Role**
As a Product Owner for the Azure & AWS Core team, you will the product lead of a team of highly engaged peers using cutting-edge technology to develop and maintain foundational services on Azure & AWS. You will be instrumental in ensuring our technical Governance & Compliance, working closely with operations, maintenance, and security of our managed cloud platform.

You will play a crucial role in product management, overseeing the creation, maintenance, and updates of Cloud landing zones to meet various needs across SEB Group domains and divisions. Your responsibilities will include defining product vision, strategy, and roadmap, prioritizing features, and ensuring alignment with business goals. You will collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, manage product backlogs, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality solutions.

Our delivery includes guardrails, best practices, and supporting functionalities, paving the way for SEB’s developers to create a modern bank in the Clouds. Join us in building the foundation of a paradigm shift in banking. As part of our multi-cloud tribe, you will gain skills and experience in multiple Public Cloud environments.
**To Thrive in This Position, You Should Have:*** Product Management Skills: Ability to define product vision, strategy, and roadmap, prioritize features, and align with business goals.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Experience in gathering requirements, managing product backlogs, keeping on top of expectations and ensuring timely delivery.
* Hands-on experience with Azure & AWS: Demonstrated ability to manage and optimize cloud services on these platforms.
* Understanding of other Cloud Platforms such as Google Cloud: Ability to integrate and leverage diverse cloud environments.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform), automation, and CI/CD: Proficiency in deploying and managing infrastructure efficiently.
* Proficiency in TypeScript, Bash, and Python: Strong coding skills to support automation and development tasks.
* Understanding of logging, monitoring, and observability platforms: Ability to ensure system reliability and performance.
* Knowledge of Agile principles: Experience in Agile methodologies to manage product development cycles.
* Motivation and eagerness to learn: A proactive attitude towards continuous improvement and learning.
* Strong communication and presentation skills in both English and Swedish.


**What We Offer*** Entrepreneurial Scandinavian Environment: Work-life balance, international working environment, hybrid work model, empowering and welcoming culture.
* Growth Culture: Extensive training and learning opportunities, local and international internal mobility possibilities, long-term stability.
* Modern Environment: Innovative company at the forefront of technology, challenging and cutting-edge work, excellent office environment, agile and modern ways of working.
* Additional Monetary Benefits: Paid seniority vacation and volunteering days, allocations to your pension fund, profit-sharing programme, and additional health insurance.


**Do You Want to Be Part of SEB?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than **May 15th, 2025.**
**Learn more about working at SEB: Technology \u007C SEB**

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.

title: Director - Service Success Head
description:
HCL
  
HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we've never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We've always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments—no matter how big or small—can be traced back to an idea's single spark. To lead and drive the technology solutioning in LoB / vertical and to create a COE in cloud technologies and Apps migration.
  
**Experience :** 12-18 Years
  
Support and lead HCL Application team supporting VR Delivery.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

Effectively Manage multiple teams and/or customer accounts and plan/implement strategies to drive growth and margin improvement Service Success Head (SSH) specializing in Network & Security to oversee the seamless delivery of IT services to clients.
  
The SDM will be responsible for managing service operations, ensuring SLAs are met, and driving continuous improvement across network and security services.
  
This role requires strong technical expertise, leadership skills, and a customer-focused approach to IT service management.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Service Delivery & Operations Management • Oversee end-to-end network and security service delivery, ensuring high availability and performance.
  
* Ensure compliance with SLAs, KPIs, and ITIL best practices.
* Act as the primary point of contact for clients, stakeholders, and internal teams.
* Manage incident, problem, and change management processes related to network and security.
* Proactively identify risks, vulnerabilities, and areas for service improvement


Technical Leadership & Support
  
* Collaborate with network architects, security engineers, and operations teams to maintain and enhance service quality.
* Ensure firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and cloud security solutions are properly managed.
* Oversee troubleshooting and resolution of network performance and security incidents.
* Stay updated on emerging technologies, zero-trust security models, SD-WAN, and cloud security solutions.


Stakeholder & Vendor Management
  
* Manage relationships with third-party vendors, MSPs, and security solution providers.
* Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to align network & security services with business objectives.
* Conduct service reviews, audits, and governance meetings to ensure continuous service improvements. Project & Continuous Improvement Initiatives
* Lead network and security transformation projects including upgrades, migrations, and cloud integrations.
* Drive automation and DevSecOps best practices to optimize service efficiency.
* Implement cost-effective security and network solutions while maintaining compliance with industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR)Technical Leadership & Support
* Collaborate with network architects, security engineers, and operations teams to maintain and enhance service quality.
* Ensure firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and cloud security solutions are properly Managed by the Sheriff's Office
* Oversee troubleshooting and resolution of network performance and security Incidents.
* Stay updated on emerging technologies, zero-trust security models, SD-WAN, and cloud security solutions.


Project & Continuous Improvement Initiatives • Lead network and security transformation projects including upgrades, migrations, and cloud integrations. • Drive automation and DevSecOps best practices to optimize service efficiency. • Implement cost-effective security and network solutions while maintaining compliance with industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR) Service Management & Delivery • Ensure the seamless delivery of application infrastructure services meeting SLAs and KPIs. • Oversee incident, problem and change management processes for Core Infrastructure Services • Monitoring system performance uptime, and capacity to ensure optimal service availability People Leadership & Team Development • Lead a team of Service Owners, engineers and SMEs • Mentor and upskill teams in emerging technologies and best practices • Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement Required Qualifications & Experience Technical Expertise • Strong knowledge of enterprise networking (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Juniper, SD-WAN, VPNs, BGP, MPLS, WAN, LAN, Wi-Fi, etc.). • Knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks (NIST, CIS, MITRE ATT&CK), firewalls, IDS/IPS, endpoint protection, SIEM, and SOC operations. • Understanding of cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP), SASE, Zero Trust Security, and Identity & Access Management (IAM). • Understanding of network automation, scripting (Python, Ansible), and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is a plus. Leadership & Soft Skills • Proven experience in managing large-scale network and security services within an ITIL-driven environment. • Strong ability to leading leaders, lead teams, manage conflicts, and drive service excellence. • Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills. • Ability to handle high-pressure situations and drive incident resolution & root cause analysis.
company_description: We bring together the best of technology and our people to supercharge progress.

title: Certification & Training Manager
description:
**Xensam:** SAM Disrupters Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
  
We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
  
About the role As our Certification & Training Manager, you will be responsible for developing, and delivering high-quality training programs. Your role will involve training both external stakeholders (customers and partners) and internal teams (employees) to ensure they gain a deep understanding of our SAM solution.
  
You will lead engaging certification courses and training sessions tailored to both new and experienced users, equipping them with the knowledge and skills needed for success.
  
Responsibilities
  
Develop engaging and informative training materials, including presentations, manuals, video tutorials and interactive exercises, to enhance the learning experience.
  
Ensure all training materials remain current, relevant, and high-quality, aligning with the latest updates and advancements in our SAM solution.
  
Customize training sessions for diverse audiences, catering to both technical and non-technical users to ensure clarity and effectiveness.
  
Collaborate with internal teams to continuously refine and enhance training programs based on feedback, evolving technologies, and best practices.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Having experience in leading end-to-end training initiatives, managing deadlines, reporting, and overall program success.
  
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, engaging, and easily understandable content for diverse audiences.
  
Inspire and motivate users to fully leverage the software’s capabilities and maximize its value.
  
Being able to collaborate effectively with internal teams (Customer Success, Sales, R&D, Support) as well as external clients and partners to ensure seamless training experiences.
  
Experience in designing and deliver impactful training programs, including both digital and in-person sessions, supported by high-quality training materials.
  
  

**Bonus points if you have:**  

Knowledge of Software Asset Management (SAM), including license management, compliance, and software resource optimization.
  
  

Experience with SaaS and cloud technologies, including SaaS platforms and subscription models.
  
  

Understanding of compliance and software licensing, with familiarity with vendor-specific licensing rules (e.g., Microsoft, Adobe, Oracle, IBM).
  
  

What you get
  
A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  
A generous work culture with free access to drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
  
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  
Other location-specific benefits.
  
  

**At Xensam, our core values define our culture:**  

**Rebellious:** We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
  
**Humane:** We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
  
**Harmonious:** We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
  
  

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!
  
As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Document Controller Facility Upgrade Projects (Södertälje)
description:
Are you an experienced Document Controller looking to contribute to high-impact facility upgrade projects? Join our team supporting critical CAPEX initiatives within the pharmaceutical sector.
  
**Location:** Södertälje (minimum 3 days/week onsite) / 2 days Stockholm Office
  
**Duration:** Long-term assignment (initial 6 months, expected 1–2+ years)
  
  

**Allocation:**  

50% – Project 1
  
50% – Project 2
  
  

**Key Requirements:**  

Minimum 2 years of experience as a Document Controller on large-scale projects.
  
Proficiency in document control platforms like Asite and Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC).
  
Strong understanding of BIM tools and document workflows.
  
Fluent in Swedish – essential for site coordination with contractors.
  
Comfortable working in a dynamic, cross-functional project environment.
  
  

**Role Overview:**  

Lead document control implementation for global engineering projects.
  
Interface with contractors, suppliers, and internal stakeholders to manage and process project documentation.
  
Set up and manage document structures in SharePoint, Teams, and Asite.
  
Migrate documentation from contractor platforms to the client common data environment.
  
Manage document transmittals between the client and external partners.
  
Engage in global forums with Document Controllers to align on best practices.
  
Support training initiatives and promote awareness of effective document management.
  
Collaborate with the client IT for system enhancements and tool integrations.
  
Develop and oversee quality assurance processes for document management.
  
  

This is a unique and impactful role – ideal for someone ready to shape how project documentation is managed across critical initiatives.

title: Djurvårdare sökes till vår Veterinärklinik!
description:
Vi söker en engagerad Djurvårdare med erfarenhet från veterinärklinik!
  
Är du passionerad om djur och vill vara en del av ett professionellt och varmt team? Vi söker nu en djurvårdare till vår klinik för att hjälpa oss ge bästa möjliga vård till våra fyrbenta vänner!
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

Assistera vid veterinärbesök och förberedelser inför operationer.
  
Ta hand om djur under behandling och ge dem omvårdnad (utfodring, promenader, hälsokontroller).
  
Hålla kliniken ren och organiserad.
  
Kommunicera med djurägare och ge dem information om deras djurs hälsa.
  
Ta emot och lämna ut djur, samt ge instruktioner om eftervård.
  
  

**Vad vi söker hos dig:**  

Du har erfarenhet från arbete på veterinärklinik, gärna med smådjur.
  
Du har ett genuint intresse för djurs välmående och ett varmt bemötande.
  
Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om Provet Cloud-programmet, men det är inget krav.
  
Du trivs med att arbeta i team och håller ordning och struktur i ditt arbete.
  
Du är en kommunikativ och positiv person som kan hantera både hektiska och lugna arbetsmoment med ett leende.
  
  

**Vad vi erbjuder:**  

En stabil och trygg anställning på en smådjurklinik.
  
En positiv arbetsmiljö där du får vara en del av ett passionerat team.
  
Möjlighet till vidareutbildning och personlig utveckling.
  
  

Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev till jobbhagaveterinar@gmail.com.

title: Marknadskoordinator till Bio Skandia
description:
Stockholms filmfestival söker en strukturerad och initiativrik marknadskoordinator för att driva det dagliga kommunikationsarbetet på Bio Skandia. Rollen innebär ett brett ansvar – från grafisk produktion till innehåll i digitala kanaler och samordning av kampanjer – med målet att synliggöra biografens program och evenemang för en bred publik.
  
Sedan 2024 driver Stockholms filmfestival verksamheten på Bio Skandia. Biografen visar både nya filmer och klassiker, ofta i analogt format (35 mm och 70 mm), samt står värd för galapremiärer, företagsevent och andra scenprogram. Som marknadskoordinator ansvarar du för hur detta kommuniceras ut – både visuellt och strategiskt.
  
Om rollen
  
Du kommer självständigt att planera, producera och publicera marknadsföringsmaterial, hantera hemsidan, biljettsystemet och publiceringen av vårt filmprogram, samt driva utvecklingen av Bio Skandias kommunikation i digitala kanaler. Arbetet är operativt, men ställer också krav på ett helhetsperspektiv och god projektledning. Du blir en nyckelperson i att forma biografens profil utåt, och kommer arbeta nära både festivalens marknadsavdelning och Bio Skandias team på plats.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Självständigt skapa och publicera innehåll till sociala medier (Instagram, Facebook, ev. TikTok).
  
Ansvara för grafisk produktion kopplad till annonsering, sociala medier, trycksaker och digital skärmkommunikation.
  
Klippa och anpassa trailers och kortare rörligt material i Premiere Pro.
  
Skriva, samordna, skicka ut och följa upp nyhetsbrev i nära dialog med programteam.
  
Uppdatera och förbättra innehållet på hemsidan (WordPress).
  
Lägga upp och hantera filmerna på hemsidan (My Cloud Cinema).
  
Driva kampanjer för filmer, samarbeten och evenemang.
  
Löpande utvärdera och rapportera insatser.
  
Säkerställa att all kommunikation ligger i linje med varumärket för både Bio Skandia och Stockholms filmfestival.
  
  

Vi söker dig som
  
Har minst ett års erfarenhet av grafisk formgivning och digital marknadsföring.
  
Är självgående i Photoshop, InDesign och Premiere Pro.
  
Har en mycket god visuell känsla och förståelse för kommunikation i digitala kanaler.
  
Har vana att planera och driva flera projekt parallellt, och klarar av att leverera även under tidspress.
  
Är noggrann, strukturerad och lösningsorienterad.
  
Har grundläggande erfarenhet av WordPress och e-postverktyg.
  
Har intresse för film och publikarbete är ett plus.
  
  

Vi erbjuder
  
Ett självständigt och kreativt uppdrag med stor variation och ansvar.
  
Möjlighet att vara med och bygga kommunikationen för en biograf i utveckling.
  
Del av ett engagerat team inom Stockholms filmfestival.
  
Fria biobesök på Bio Skandia.
  
  

Tjänsten innefattar heltid 100% och är tillsvidare.
  
Ansökan
  
Skicka din ansökan till producent@stockholmfilmfestival.se med CV, kort personligt brev och portfolio senast 16 april. Berätta gärna varför du söker rollen och hur du arbetar med grafisk kommunikation och projektledning i praktiken.
  
Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Sr. Manager Consultant - AI
description:
**Who We Are**

At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.  



  

**The Role**

Do you have a passion for driving meaningful change through technology? Are you an expert in AI and eager to make an impact on our customers? We're seeking a talented AI Strategy Consultant to join our team for multi-disciplinary, complex consulting engagements.


As an AI Strategy Consultant at Kyndryl, you'll be responsible for delivering value to customers and Kyndryl by applying deep domain, technology, and industry expertise, consulting techniques, and cognitive approaches to analyze issues and create innovative AI-driven solutions. You'll establish milestones, quality targets, and manage the work of others while possessing strong communication skills to articulate the impact and business benefits of your AI solutions and manage stakeholder expectations.


In this role, you will use your experience and knowledge in guiding customers in their adoption of AI technologies, including machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. You will advise customers on AI technology options and help them make strategic choices and decisions. Additionally, you will have experience capturing and prioritizing complex requirements and resolving conflicting requirements. But that's not all – our AI Strategy Consultants have seen how organizations benefit from AI-driven change and most importantly, know how to plan for it – giving our partners and customers the confidence to make a convincing case for it.


As a trusted and experienced Consultant, you will be responsible for a vast number of essential technical components such as analyzing the customer's current state, defining AI Strategy including key outcomes, designing conceptual AI solutions, planning and executing design and implementation work (with support from technical specialists), and accounting for time, cost, and quality targets. You will also develop IP and own specific assets, tools, and white papers articulating point of views in AI, assemble and lead a team of consultants and architects, and facilitate and capture lessons learned from engagements to update methodologies and assets.


Moreover, you will play a pivotal role in educating and training customers on AI technologies, conducting workshops, seminars, and lectures to share your expertise and insights. Your ability to communicate complex AI concepts in an accessible manner will empower customers to leverage AI effectively within their organizations.  



  

Your Future at Kyndryl
  

As an IT Strategy Consultant at Kyndryl you will join the Kyndryl Consultant Profession, working with other Kyndryl Consultants, Architects, Project Managers, and cross-functional Technical Subject Matter Experts. Whether you want to lead multi-disciplined teams as a Senior Strategy Consultant or delve into transforming Fortune 500 companies as a Strategy and Transformation Consultant – you’ll have access to unlimited opportunities with Kyndryl.  



  

**Who You Are**

You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
  

  

Required Skills and Experience
  

  

* Consulting experience with an IT professional service “big 4” firm or similar background focused on IT strategy enablement
* Knowledge of major cloud technologies including virtualization, containers, networking etc. on different cloud platforms
* Subject matter expertise in at least three domains (e.g., cloud computing, IT strategy, infrastructure, IT operations, applications, enterprise architecture, solution architecture, automation, data management, AI/ML, IoT and cloud governance models) to advise on industry-leading solutions
* Data modeling and analytical experience using common tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau)
* Issue-based analysis determined and structured data to collect, and produced structured conclusions, recommendations, and roadmaps
* Knowledge of IT Operating Model and Process Frameworks
* Awareness of broad competencies and depth in specific competency areas (IT strategy, enterprise architecture, solution architecture, process reengineering, automation)
* Ability to lead/facilitate workshops and interviews, great presentation skills
* Understanding of DevSecOps, Agile, Scrum construct to identify inefficiencies through readiness assessments and development of strategies and approaches to optimize the implementation of IT or cloud resources and capabilities

  

Preferred Skills and Experience
  

  

* Experience in the areas of IT and/or cloud technology architecture, service management and/or resiliency
* ITSM and ITIL or COBIT certification
* Business case skills, ROI, and TCO analysis to validate IT strategy
* Experience leading workshops and interviews for discovery and assessment engagements
  

**Being You**

Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.  



  

**What You Can Expect**

With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.


**Get Referred!**

If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Redovisningsekonom till konsultuppdrag på distans
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren redovisningsekonom för ett konsultuppdrag i Sverige hos en av våra kunder med möjlighet till heltid på distans. Du kommer att ha en central roll inom ekonomiavdelningen och rapportera direkt till CFO.

##### **Exempel på arbetsuppgifter som redovisningsekonom:**

* Hantera löpande bokföring och redovisningsuppgifter.
* Förbereda och genomföra bokslut samt avstämningar.
* Ansvara för ekonomisk rapportering internt och externt.
* Ge råd och stöd till olika avdelningar i ekonomiska frågor.

##### **Om dig**


Du har flera års erfarenhet av liknande uppgifter inom redovisning och har tidigare arbetat i Oracle Cloud. Du är självgående, strukturerad och har en god digital vana.

##### **Detaljer om konsultuppdraget**


Uppdraget är på heltid med start omgående och pågår till december 2025. Du kan arbeta helt på distans. Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du kan välja att bli anställd av oss eller fakturera med F-skattsedel.

##### **Ansökningsprocess**


Välkommen med din ansökan och eventuella frågor!


Om Seemly Finance & Search


Vi erbjuder effektiva lösningar inom rekrytering och konsultinhyrning. Med oss får du professionell och snabb hjälp inom områden såsom rekrytering, search, interim management, konsultinhyrning och headhunting. Vi fokuserar på att rekrytera fördomsfritt och kompetensbaserat till chefer och specialister för både stora koncerner, ägarledda bolag samt kommuner och kommunala bolag.


Vi erbjuder även outsourcing inom redovisning och lön och stöttar företag och dess ägare med löpande bokföring, bokslut, deklarationer, årsredovisningar, hållbarhetsredovisning samt företagsrådgivning. Läs mer om oss på www.finance.seemlygroup.com

title: Junior Data Technology Consultant
description:

* 

##### 

##### **Application Process:**

title: Talent Acquisition Business Partner
description:
**Talent Acquisition Business Partner, Capgemini Invent**
---------------------------------------------------------

As the digital innovation, design and transformation brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in over 30 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,500+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.


Capgemini Invent SweDFi (Sweden, Denmark & Finland) is growing and looking for a **Talent Acquisition Business Partner** to our fast-paced, dynamic and social Talent Acquisition team. Your primary responsibility is to deliver on our yearly graduate recruitment targets. This means you will be in the driver’s seat and lead the daily work to attract and meet the targets set to recruit Capgemini Invent’s graduate intake for Sweden, Denmark and Finland. This is a responsibility with a crucial impact in continuing securing our growth and position in the market. The role is visible, independent, hands-on and with a broad responsibility, interacting with multiple stakeholders across our target operating model and candidates.  



**What you will do**

* Deliver end-to-end and successfully manage our yearly graduate recruitment within all our capability units and industries in Sweden, Denmark and Finland.
* Be responsible for all stages of the recruitment process, from advertising to signed contracts.
* Work closely but independently with our Head of Talent Acquisition, hiring managers and other stakeholders.
* Secure and deliver a professional and great experience to candidates and all internal stakeholders.
* Develop and further improve our recruitment processes and candidate experience.
* Employer branding: work with our EB core team and team leads responsible for our target universities.
* Administrative tasks such as contract writing and status reporting.
In addition, when/if time left during the year support our senior recruitment agenda.  
* 
**Candidate profile**
---------------------

**What you will bring**

* Minimum 3+ years of relevant experience after graduation from a fast-paced environment. Ideally from a management consultancy working in a similar in-house role, alternatively from a recruitment consultancy or a larger line organization.
* Passion for recruitment, talent attraction, great service mentality, energy, drive, and being recognized as a trusted advisor.
* You have experience from, and are a natural, project manager, adept at prioritizing and getting things done.
* An independent, structured way of working with attention to detail. The role is broad and versatile, so you must be great at juggling multiple activities, seeing and understanding the big picture while at the same time being on top of the small details.
* A flexible mindset and ability to handle rapidly changing prioritization.
* An academic foundation of relevance.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Proficient in MS Office; Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
* Experience from Employer Branding activities is a plus.
* Solid experience from head hunting/desk research is an advantage.

This position reports to the Talent Acquisition, Capgemini Invent Sweden, Denmark, Finland and is located at our headquarters in **Kungsholmen, Stockholm**

**Why join the Talent Acquisition Team and Capgemini Invent?**
--------------------------------------------------------------

This is a great opportunity to work as an advisor within talent attraction in an international management consultancy. Proactivity, networking, collaboration, and ambition thrive and are the foundations at Capgemini Invent. You will be a member of a growing and winning team with a great team spirit and high energy. We have a strong focus on our people, with opportunities to propel your development and career.


In addition to being a member of the Talent Acquisition team for SweDFi, you will have the opportunity to network with Talent Acquisition colleagues globally though our Global Talent Acquisition Network.


**Rewrite your future**

Please apply with your CV in English. We review applications on a rolling basis. We look forward to hearing from you!


Capgemini Invent is an integral part of Capgemini, a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.


Get to know us better! Please visit www.capgemini.com/invent look us up on Instagram @capgeminiinvent\_swedfi or listen in to an episode of our podcast Future Sight with Capgemini Invent, available on Spotify.

title: Relationsbyggande Telesäljare B2B
description:
Vill du vara en del av en energifylld arbetsmiljö där sammanhållning och gemenskap står i fokus? Som telesäljare för B2B erbjuder vi en spännande möjlighet för dig som brinner för försäljning att att ta nästa steg i karriären!
  
  

Ditt nya jag, i vårt lag
  
  

Vi på Telesales Företag är ett sammansvetsat team som fokuserar på att skapa starka och långvariga relationer med våra kunder, samtidigt som vi arbetar mot tydliga mål. Vi tillhandahåller Tres mobila lösningar till både befintliga och nya kunder och du kommer aktivt att bygga och hantera din egen kundbas för att säkerställa återkommande kunder. Vi ser till att du får alla förutsättningar och verktyg för att utvecklas i din roll som säljare, med kontinuerlig coaching och utbildning.
  
  

Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vi söker dig
  
  

Som har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med försäljning och brinner för att skapa meningsfulla relationer. Du värdesätter samarbete och tar stort ägandeskap i dina arbetsuppgifter. Vi tror på att skapa en balans mellan service och skicklig försäljning, och vi värdesätter din förmåga att framgångsrikt bygga starka och långvariga relationer. Hos oss är det driv och vi söker dig som delar vårt fokus på mål.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig
  
  

En gedigen introduktion och löpande utbildning för att ge dig de bästa förutsättningarna att lyckas i rollen.
  
En tillsvidareanställning på heltid (måndag till fredag) med grundlön, obegränsad provisionsmöjlighet och en attraktiv kvartalsbonus.
  
En roll på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser där vi sätter våra medarbetare i fokus samt att vi är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar.
  
En företagskultur vi är mycket stolta över, som inkluderar roliga tävlingar, aktiviteter och awards.
  
En möjlighet att vara en del av att leverera kritisk infrastruktur och bidra direkt till samhällsnyttan.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på några frågor vi ställer i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag, föräldrarlön, pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
  
  

Flexibla helgdagar och fem dagar extra ledigt per år
  
  

Hundzon & gym i 3huset
  
  

Subventionerad lunch
  
  

Förmånliga rabatter på cyklar, kollektivtrafik och elbilar
  
  

Generösa bonusmodeller eller provisioner
  
  

Vi drivs av att hela tiden försöka göra saker bättre, på nya och annorlunda sätt. Vi ser oss själva som en avgörande del av Sveriges samhällsstruktur, eftersom vi vet att pålitlig uppkoppling är en viktig grundsten i dagens digitala värld.
  
  

Tre föddes som utmanare och är en organisation i ständig rörelse. Vi strävar efter att vara i framkant i allt vi gör. Vi är övertygade om att det är människorna och kulturen på Tre som är avgörande för vår utveckling.
  
  

När du startar din resa på Tre finns det oändliga möjligheter att växa och utvecklas med oss.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - I en föränderlig värld, är vi på Tre nyfikna och ständigt öppna för nya lösningar. På Tre anpassar vi vägen framåt allt eftersom vi provar och lär oss vad som funkar bäst.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - På Tre gör vi alltid vårt bästa. Vi känner ägandeskap för vår uppgift, sätter tydliga mål och håller fokus på det som gör mest nytta för affären.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - På Tre är vi schyssta kollegor. Vi samarbetar med varandra över team och funktioner, vi bollar idéer, ger och tar emot feedback.
  
  

2003
  
Tre först i Sverige med videosamtal och strömning av mobil video. Att se personen som du ringer upp i ögonen är en helt ny upplevelse vid den här tidpunkten.
  
  

2006
  
Tre lanserar mobilt bredband som tredje operatör i världen. Under de kommande fem åren vinner Tre pris för Sveriges snabbaste mobila bredband.
  
  

2013
  
Tre’s systerbolag Hallon startas med en vision att vara den enkla mobiloperatören utan onödigt krångel.
  
  

2019
  
Ett händelserikt år! 3Världen lanseras som innebär att kunder kan surfa i 80 länder till samma pris som inom Sverige. Därefter lanseras 3Samla som gör att alla kunder kan lägga till fler användare till sitt abonnemang och sist men inte minst är Tre först i Sverige med ett lansera ett publikt 5G-nät.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena byter från 1 januari namn till 3Arena. Med vår starka passion för innovation, uppkoppling och upplevelser ska vi medverka till arenans och områdets utveckling.
  
  

Sandra Holmqvist Södermark | Kontaktperson

title: Inside Sales Specialist - Cloud
description:
**Why Choose TD SYNNEX:**
  

  

As a **Fortune 500 global corporation**, operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 22,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.  

  

**About the role:**
  

  

As an **Inside Sales Specialist,** you will join the sales team **within Cloud**. You'll build Excellent customer and vendor sales relationships through proactive engagement and demonstrable specialist product knowledge under supervision.
  

  

**What you'll do:**
  

* Generate new business opportunities by planning outbound calls to customers and can have a general conversation around a solution/product area
* Achieve monthly/quarterly Revenue and Margin targets
* Proactively develop relationships with key internal and external contacts
* Drives sales of specific products/ vendors if specific knowledge is required
* Provides accurate and timely quotations
* Generate and own a pipeline of deals in TD SYNNEX's CRM system, which is regularly reviewed and updated and ensure active closure of opportunities
* Manage customer backorder expectations and reporting
* Ensure CRM system is well maintained and provides correct customer information
* Provide, sell and negotiate product information, pricing, special offers and promotions

  

**What we're kindly looking for:**
  

* 1-2 years of experience in Sales.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Numerate with good attention to detail
* Excellent telephone manner
* Priority management and planning skills
* Strive to achieve set targets

  

**What We Offer:**
  

  

We provide competitive compensation with **annual salary reviews.**  

  

**Hybrid work** - (3 days at the office, 2 days at home)  

  

We value continuous learning and provide a clear progression plan.  

  

We provide **comprehensive benefits** including **health insurance**, paid leave, retirement plans, and more.  

  

#LI-LT1  

  

#LI-HYBRID  

  

**Key Skills**  

  

**What's In It For You?**  

* **Elective Benefits:** Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* **Grow Your Career:** Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* **Elevate Your Personal Well-Being:** Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion:** It's not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* **Make the Most of our Global Organization**: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* **Connect with Your Community:** Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.

  

**Don't meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**  

  

At TD SYNNEX, we're proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you're excited about working for our company and believe you're a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we're looking for!

title: Product Manager
description:
Introducing evroc
 
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European hyperscale cloud.
 



**Location:** 
  Stockholm
   

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
 


 The Team
 
 During this early stage of our journey, we operate as an integrated and cohesive team, combining Product Management with Customer & Partner Success. This close collaboration ensures a unified view of customer needs, aligns product development with real-world feedback, and enhances communication and collaboration. By integrating these functions, we foster a customer-centric culture, improve resource allocation, streamline processes, and provide clear accountability.
 



 As we scale our product management team over time, we envision forming multiple specialized teams, each focusing on specific products. By joining us at this foundational stage, you have a unique opportunity to significantly shape our product strategy, drive the direction of future development, and collaborate closely with other stakeholders.
 


 The Role
 
 evroc is looking for an innovative and experienced Product Manager to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you will play a crucial part in defining, developing, and driving our product strategy, ensuring alignment with evroc’s mission of building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud. You will lead product initiatives from ideation to execution, focusing on defining ground-breaking cloud solutions that address the evolving needs of our customers and the market.
 


 What You'll Tackle
 * Understand customer needs, formulate problem statements, and drive the creation and execution of excellent products that sets the direction for future cloud solutions.


* Develop and maintain a comprehensive product roadmap with key milestones and deliverables.


* Define product features and requirements, write specifications and user stories, and develop prototypes.


* Collaborate cross-functional to execute the product roadmap and engage clients to implement product plans and deliver world-class cloud services.


* Support business development, identify strategic partnerships, and assist with customer onboarding, training, and support, leveraging insights from Customer Success to improve product offerings.


* Work closely with Sales and Marketing to define product positioning, launch strategies, and provide necessary documentation and training resources.


* Coordinate efforts across Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Engineering, and other teams to ensure seamless customer engagement and project delivery.


* Monitor market trends, competitive landscape, and regulatory changes to inform product strategy and maintain a competitive edge.


 Skills we value
 * Proven experience in Product management in cloud services or related fields, with a track record of steering product strategies from conception through execution.


* Ability to create and articulate a compelling product vision that inspires and motivates cross-functional teams.


* Hands-on experience of building cloud services, with a deep understanding of the needs and pain points of developers and cloud customers.


* Strong knowledge of cloud technologies, data privacy regulations (GDPR), and sustainability practices.


* Experience working with customers and understanding their requirements when adopting cloud solutions.


* Ability to manage multiple products and projects, ensuring timely delivery and meeting deadlines; ability to work independently and take initiative.


* Strong problem-solving skills and a strategic mindset to navigate complex challenges.


* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, capable of aligning multiple stakeholders and driving cross-functional teamwork.


* Ability to effectively interact with engineers - the ideal candidate will possess the necessary technical background to understand and communicate technical requirements.


* Strong English communication skills are required.


* Experience with large-scale distributed systems.



 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
 



 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.

title: Cloud Support Technician
description:
*Zelly är ett ledande ”born-in-the-cloud” företag . Vi utvecklar och optimerar molntjänster från Microsoft och ser till att våra kunder har tillgång till de bäst lämpade molntjänsterna för deras verksamhet.*
**Nu har du chansen att hänga med på vår tillväxtresa!**
 Vi på Zelly växer och behöver nu en till Cloud Support Technician till Customer Care teamet. Vi söker nu dig som är ambitiös med en positiv inställning. Zelly är ett dynamiskt och snabbväxande Cloud-bolag som levererar alla Microsofts plattformar. Vi har en Cloud first-approach och ser styrkan i att nyttja synergier i Microsofts ekosystem. Zelly är den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som vill utvecklas, gillar att ta ansvar och ha möjligheten att påverka din arbetsplats. Vi ser att du är hungrig på ny teknik, vill hjälpa kunder till en bättre, enklare och säkrare vardag.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I supporten har vi daglig kontakt med många av de kunder som använder vår plattform. Kundservice är en central och väsentlig del i vår verksamhet då våra kunders framgång är detsamma som framgång för oss på Zelly. Din främsta uppgift blir att i supporten hantera inkommande ärenden från kunder via ärendehanteringssystem, telefon och mail. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär bland annat felsökning i en Windowsmiljö, konto- och behörighetshantering i Active Directory, Azure AD, Office 365, problemlösning för skrivare, nätverk, dokumentation och en hel del annat. Komplexiteten av ärenden varierar mycket och utvecklingsmöjligheterna är stora.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i Servicedesk med IT-support eller teknisk support
* Kunskap inom exempelvis Windows Server, Active Directory, Azure, Office 365, nätverk & hårdvara
* Strukturerad och organiserad
* förmågan att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska
* Genuin passion för IT och digitalisering
* Van att ha mycket kundkontakt


**För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du:**
* Är intresserad av cloud produkter och dess utveckling
* Trivs med frihet under ansvar
* Gillar att utveckla rutiner och processer


**Dina Möjligheter Hos Oss**
* Bra villkor och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett snabbt expanderande IT-bolag!
* Möjlighet till delägarskap i Aderian Group som är koncernen som Zelly ingår i
* Då vårt mål är att du ska bli bäst på molntjänster betalar vi gärna för din fortbildning. För när du utvecklas – utvecklas vi!
* Självklart erbjuder vi både förmåner och bonusar
* Roliga resor och aktiviteter tillsammans!


 Rekrytering sker löpande – där tillträde och lön sker enligt överenskommelse. Vi kommer att genomföra en bakgrundskontroll som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs!

title: Enterprise Sales Director Sweden
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Picture Yourself At Pega**
 Imagine leading a dynamic team at Pegasystems, where innovation meets excellence. As the Director of Sales (Enterprise) for the Nordics, you’ll be a pivotal leader and key addition to the Central (DACH & Nordics) Management team. Since 2008, Pega has been revolutionising the customer journey for millions, working with well-known clients in the region, leveraging cutting-edge technology. Pega is The Enterprise Transformation Company™ that empowers organisations to Build for Change® with groundbreaking enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation solutions. This unique opportunity involves hiring and coaching a world-class enterprise sales team, developing pipelines, strategic planning, account management, accurate forecasting, and consistently achieving defined sales quotas within the MEDDPICC qualification framework.
   

  

**Meet Our Team**
 Join a team that is at the forefront of industry transformation. As the recognized leader in strategic business application by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner, we challenge companies to rethink their business models and empower them to become more efficient, smarter, and customer-centric.
   

  

 Our Nordics Go-To-Market team is centered around our Stockholm office. We work in a hybrid model, offering the flexibility to work from home, client sites, or at our Stockholm office, while regularly connecting with your team to achieve outstanding results together.
   

  

**What You'll Do At Pega**
**Lead, Inspire & Empower** 
 your team to reach their full potential by listening, empowering, and driving accountability through empathetic leadership. Foster a collaborative, high-trust culture of top achievers, emphasizing OnePega sales engagement and a strong learning environment.
   

  

**Drive Sales Strategy -** 
 Set sales targets and ensure pipeline and forecast accuracy. Demonstrate operational cadence and engage meaningfully with C-level executives to create value, drive commercial outcomes, and identify significant upselling opportunities
   

  

**Implement Strategic Partnerships:** 
 Develop and execute a Sell-With and Sell-To strategy by leveraging top SIs, MSPs, and consulting firms in the DACH region
   

  

**Hire, train, and coach** 
 new and existingSales Executive team members to master the MEDDPICC Sales methodology, develop compelling territory plans, integrating the best of Pega’s internal ecosystem (marketing, inside sales, legal, presales, etc.) for successful deal realization.
   

  

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Build effective working relationships with cross-functional GTM teams, including Solution Consulting, Delivery Services, Marketing, our Partner community, and the Pega Sales executive team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. You are a natural coach and mentor, thriving in these roles. You bring to Pega a proven track record of sales and leadership performance, characterized not just by a network of C-level connections, but by a wealth of best practices and innovative approaches. You are humble, authentic, and curious, and you excel in a fast-paced SaaS environment.
   

  

**What You've Accomplished**
* BA/BS/Masters or equivalent work experience
* 12+ years of industry-related sales experience, including 5+ years of experience in sales management (minimum)
* Business or fluent Swedish & English expected.
* Enterprise SAAS and/or complex software transformation solution sales background
* Strong listening, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ideally thought leadership on Cloud Modernization and AI Transformation.


**Pega Offers You**
* A rapidly growing yet well-established business with the world’s most innovative organizations as referenceable clients.
* A proven track record in AI, showcasing our deep understanding and continuous innovation in this field. We are recognized as leaders by analysts in emerging markets.
* A comprehensive portfolio of benefits and rewards designed to support and excite our team members.
* A culture that truly values flexibility, family, and learning .
