title: Partner Sales Manager, Google Workspace
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 8 years of experience in driving sales growth within a direct and indirect sales.
* 6 years of experience in partner sales or channel management, within the technology sector in SaaS.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience with cloud ecosystem.
* Knowledge of System Integrators (SIs)/Service Providers (SPs) and Independent Software Vendors (ISVs).
* Knowledge of Generative AI landscape.
* Ability to grow in a dynamic, and fluid environment.


**About The Job**
 The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive partners to build a robust partner sourced business pipeline, track opportunities, and accurately forecast business in collaboration with partners providing regular reporting to management.
* Meet and exceed partner-level monthly, quarterly and annual agreed goals for new business and expansion of business pipeline, as well as operational metrics.
* Leverage the Google Web Server (GWS) strategy and business plays with partners to develop a healthy new and expansion demand across the assigned region, deliver partner business enablement including pitching and demos with partner engineers.
* Develop relationships with Google Workspace partner engineers and Google partner engineers ensuring customers receive quality technical guidance and solution delivery from the portfolio.
* Partner with cloud partner development managers and sales teams to develop joint account plans, identify opportunities, and support the closing of complex agreement.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**About the Job** 




  





 Want to be part of building the future of Sales for companies everywhere? Where AI Meets Human Communication!
 



 Our client is spearheading a revolution in Sales by empowering sales agents to excel through automated personalized coaching powered by advanced AI technology.
 



 They are on a mission to shape the future of sales for businesses globally, and are looking for talented individuals to join their amazing team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, software developers, designers, and more in their Stockholm office.
 



 The company is transforming sales professionals' lives worldwide—building more connected and efficient teams at the intersection of behavioural science and automation.
 



 The state-of-the-art AI technology is redefining how sales professionals learn to communicate with confidence and precision in every interaction. Monitoring everything down to the customer’s tone of voice, picking up buying signals and offering live advice to agents and managers.
 



 The team previously built and held leadership roles at industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle by PayPal, Sana and EF. We’re now building a new category leader in AI, solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally.
 



 They are located in Stockholm, Sweden, and are backed by a global group of prominent and heavy-hitting tech entrepreneurs and investors.
 



  





**Role and Challenges 🚀** 




  




* Design and develop machine learning models to extract insights, predict sales outcomes, and optimize coaching recommendations.
* Work with large-scale data sets, ensuring data integrity, feature engineering, and pre-processing pipelines.
* Collaborate closely with software engineers and product managers to integrate AI-driven solutions into our core platform.
* Deploy and optimize models in production, ensuring efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
* Analyse model performance, troubleshoot issues, and iterate on improvements to maximize impact.
* Contribute to research and development efforts to push the boundaries of AI in sales automation.
* Stay current with industry trends in AI, data science, and machine learning, proposing innovative solutions to enhance our product offerings.



  





**What We're Looking For 🤩** 




  




* Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, with expertise in AI-driven applications.
* Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy).
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP for deploying and managing ML models.
* Experience in handling and analysing large datasets, developing data pipelines, and implementing feature engineering techniques.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business challenges into data-driven solutions.
* Familiarity with NLP, time-series forecasting, or recommender systems is a plus.
* Experience in mentoring junior data scientists or leading projects is highly desirable.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional team.
* A proactive, self-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.



  





**What’s On Offer? 👀** 




  




* Competitive salary & equity package
* Mobile phone reimbursement
* Six weeks annual paid vacation
* Wellness budget
* Learning & development budget



  





 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Domain Architect, Customer Solutions, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
PostNord is the leading supplier of logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We make everyday life easier by providing solutions for communications, logistics, distribution, and e-commerce. Our mission is to connect people and businesses reliably and efficiently.
   

  

 Customer Solutions is one of four Solution Areas within PostNord IT, comprising around 150 professionals across multiple teams. We handle all customer-facing products, including the PostNord App, PostNord Business Portal and various customer APIs. Our product teams manage their products from start to finish.
   

  

 The Customer Solutions department at PostNord is structured to ensure efficient collaboration and innovation. The department is led by the head of Customer Solutions and includes various Product Owners and Technical Leads responsible for different aspects of customer solutions. This structure ensures that each area of customer solutions is managed by dedicated professionals who focus on delivering the best possible outcomes.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled Domain Architect to join our Customer Solutions department. As a Domain Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing and improving all aspects of our customer interactions working closely with various departments and development teams to ensure that our solutions are aligned with business goals and deliver exceptional customer experiences. You will have technical responsibility over 15 teams, guiding them to achieve excellence in their respective areas. This role requires a strong emphasis on collaboration and support, combined with the ability to set clear guardrails to guide the development process. You will report to Head of Customer Solutions and collaborate with Enterprise Architecture Team.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to development teams and especially Tech Leads, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions.
* Lead the design and architecting of customer-facing applications by setting the target architecture for the domain and ensuring the architecture meets the business-needs, such as scability, security and user-friendliness
* Collaborate with Enterprise Architect team to drive the domain architecture board for decision-making, and lead the Customer Solutions organization in following PostNords standards, guidelines and guardlines.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, incorporate them into the architecture as appropriate.
* Align with Cyber Security Department and address security questions within the department.


**Who are we looking for?**
**Qualifications**
 We are looking for you who has proven experience as a Domain Architect or similar role, ideally within a customer-focused environment. You should have a strong understanding of architecture frameworks and methodologies. Additionally, the following qualifications are required:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience with customer-facing solutions towards consumers, businesses, and partners is required.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving skills and strategic thinking abilities.
* Familiarity with Agile Architecture and strategies for scaling Agile development is essential. This includes understanding how to adapt Agile methodologies to large-scale projects and ensuring that architectural practices support Agile principles.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


 It is also meritorious if you have previous experience of Customer Relationship Management systems as well as knowledge of cloud technologies and modern software development practices. Experience in the logistics industry is also a plus.
   

  

**We offer you**
 Joining PostNord means becoming part of a dynamic and innovative team. You'll work in a supportive environment that truly values your contributions, offering generous opportunities for professional growth. Here, you can make a meaningful impact on both our customers' lives and the overall success of our business.
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application! The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email pontus.brohult@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives

title: Account Executive (New Business Sales) – Manufacturing, Logistics, Automotive, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and T&H Sectors – Sweden
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Cognizant**
 At Cognizant (Nasdaq: CTSH), we engineer modern businesses to improve everyday life because we're dedicated to making a lasting impact. We help our clients modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they can stay ahead in our fast-changing world. Together, we're improving everyday life. See how at www.cognizant.com or @cognizant.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Reporting to the EMEA Chief Commercial Officer and aligned to Cognizant’s Products & Resources (MLEU + RCGTH) Business Unit, Cognizant is looking for an experienced “Account Executive” to join their new business sales team.
   

  

 As a new business Account Executive, you are an enterprise sales professional experienced in selling to and opening new logo accounts.
   

  

 Selling the full suite of Cognizant’s services and solutions, including market leading capabilities in Digital, Data, AI, and Cloud, etc, you know how to create value and drive business outcomes. This role will have responsibility for pursuing 10-15 targeted Accounts. Accounts will typically be oriented geographically to location but may include marquee accounts outside of Sweden. The Account Executive will work with a Client Partner and team that will support all sales pursuits and an offshore team will provide targeted marketing into designated accounts.
   

  

**Your Background**
* Demonstrable track record in new business / net new logo sales for a large Tier 1 or Tier 2 Global Systems Integrator
* Experience of working alongside and building relationships within major Manufacturing, Logistics, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and Travel & Hospitality organizations
* Experience of working for a Global Services Firm with onshore, nearshore and offshore capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience selling similar Services including Digital, Data, Cloud, Consulting and application modernization
* Demonstrable success selling multi million, multi-year deals.
* Demonstrable consecutive quarterly and yearly quota achievement in complex selling environments utilizing a solution selling model.


**Top Reasons To Join Our Team**
* Excellent compensation/benefits. A strong financial incentive package that includes a solid base salary with a highly attractive commissions plan. Further incentives include award programs, club trips, and excellent benefits package.
* Wide exposure to industry, product and functional best practices; as well as world-class teams supporting your sales pursuits.
* Supportive management team that rewards initiative & success.
* Exciting, industry leading practice where you can truly build a long-term career.
* Congenial, collaborative, and success-oriented culture; the opportunity to work with and learn from a diverse, highly experienced team of business professionals. Tremendous opportunities for growth with a real career path promoting career advancement.


**A Good Fit For The Cognizant Culture**
 A person who possesses a true passion for changing organizations for the better, and desires to do so within a success-oriented, yet professional atmosphere filled with business professionals who all manifest a belief in partnership, innovation, and excellence. Our “Cultural Value Drivers” are well-known and clearly communicated within the organization: Open, Transparent, Driven, Empowered, Opportunity-Filled, Flexible & Collaborative.

title: RAN Solution Engineer
description:
We are now looking for a RAN Solution Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm! In this role you will mostly be working with customers in Stockholm, but some traveling to customers in other Nordic countries will be expected. Are you our next RAN solution expert?
 *Get the future you want and apply today!*
**Responsibilities**
* Lead the design and implementation of RAN networks, including LTE, and 5G NR (New Radio) technologies.
* Oversee the deployment and integration of RAN nodes (e.g., eNBs, gNBs, RRU, BBU, Small Cells) into existing networks. Ensure proper network functionality and performance or worked in past for these kinds of roles.
* Design, validate, and implement 5G architecture and next-gen technologies (e.g., Carrier Aggregation (CA), MIMO, Massive MIMO, beamforming, Network Slicing).
* Provide input into the strategic planning of future RAN technologies. Lead initiatives in network automation, cloud-native RAN, and virtualized RAN (vRAN),
* Support pre-sales team and Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users
* Ability to deliver presentations and demonstrations confidently to technical and non-technical audiences
* Work closely with core network engineers, backhaul engineers, and service providers to ensure seamless integration of RAN with the broader network.
* Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements and standards for network deployment and operations.
* Undertake technical ownership and responsibility for small to medium sized opportunities and accounts
* Drive the pre-sales discussions, presentations and customer meetings


**Required Skills & Qualifications**
* Min 10 years in RAN design, optimization, and troubleshooting, with at least 5 years of experience in 5G/LTE technologies.
* Strong understanding of 4G LTE, 5G NR, including radio interface protocols, PHY/MAC layers, and eNB/gNB configurations.
* Expertise in 5G NR technology, 5G core network integration, network slicing, and related 5G innovations (e.g., massive MIMO, beamforming, Carrier Aggregation).

title: Konsultchef inom D365 SCM till Enterprise Applications
description:
***Vi på Nexer Enterprise Applications söker en affärsinriktad och strategisk konsultchef till vårt Supply Chain Management (SCM) team. Vi är ett välkänt namn inom Microsoft Dynamics och Microsoft 365. Vill du arbeta på ett tillväxtbolag i framkant som lägger stor vikt vid individens utveckling och där du kan vara med och påverka vår resa framåt? Just nu söker vi en konsultchef med gedigen erfarenhet av SCM till ett av våra Dynamics-team!***
**Hur ser rollen ut?**
 Hos oss leder och utvecklar du ett team av SCM-experter och bidrar aktivt till vår affärsutveckling och kundrelationer. Vi söker dig som har en stark förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer och som drivs av att skapa värde för både kunder och medarbetare. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i vår verksamhet, ingå i ledningsgruppen för Dynamics och forma framtiden för Nexer Enterprise Applications.
   

  

 Du kommer också att ha ansvar för rekrytering av nya talanger, genomföra löne- och utvecklingssamtal samt säkerställa att våra medarbetare har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas, både genom utveckling och coaching.
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Hybrid tjänst med bas i Stockholm
   

  

**Start** 
**:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse där vi givetvis tar hänsyn till nuvarande uppsägningstid.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du är en motiverande ledare med affärsorienterat tänkande och som vill driva förändring. Du är van vid att arbeta med olika intressenter och har erfarenhet från konsultbranschen. Det är viktigt att du har en djup förståelse för affärsprocesserna inom SCM.
   

  

 Vidare tror vi att du tidigare har arbetat med:
   

  

* Dynamics 365 SCM och/eller i en konsultroll inom SCM, alternativt som lösningsarkitekt
* Budget- och resultatansvar samt uppföljning
* Försäljning / Pre-Sales
* Personalansvar


 Du har god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Hur är det att arbeta på Nexer Enterprise Applications?**
 På Nexer Enterprise Applications har vi en familjär kultur med en bra sammanhållning i teamen. Arbetsmiljön genomsyras av en kamratlig stämning och ett nära ledarskap. Vi är ett välbekant namn när det gäller Microsoft Dynamics och Microsoft 365 inom Sverige och över hela världen. Du får möjlighet att arbeta inom Sverige och även globalt eftersom det är där våra kunder finns. Vi erbjuder en unik kombination av den stora organisationens stabilitet och den lilla verksamhetens möjlighet att påverka och få saker att hända.
   

  

 Vi har en stark vilja att driva affärer och firar våra framgångar genom regelbundna events, resor och konferenser.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om oss: https://nexergroup.com/about-us/our-business-areas/ba-enterprise-applications/
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan nedan. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via formuläret och hanterar dem löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer, kontakta gärna Maja Åström på Maja.astrom@nexergroup.com. Vänta inte med att söka!

title: Solutions Architect - Data & Analytics
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
Verdane is a specialist growth equity investment firm partnering with sustainable, tech-enabled businesses in Europe to achieve international growth. We are currently looking for a Solutions Architect within data and analytics to join our team!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are seeking a skilled Solutions Architect to lead our data modeling efforts and manage the technical setup and use of our visualisation tools. In this role, you will be at the forefront of transforming our data landscape, guiding the creation of domain-specific datasets that are scalable, performant, and highly usable for business needs.
 



  





 Your primary responsibility will be to support data analysts in building robust data models and business logic for various business areas, establishing best practices to support innovation, scalability and quality. You will also ensure the effective use of important features within our visualisation tools. This includes defining standards for development and deployment of reports, as well as their accessibility for business users.
 



  





 Your expertise will be crucial in enhancing our data infrastructure and ensuring that our analytics capabilities meet the demands of a dynamic business environment. In addition to technical expertise, we value strong interpersonal skills and the ability to adapt to various roles and responsibilities within the Verdane team.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Own and manage data modeling work (currently done in dbt and Power BI semantic models) to support business decision-making, ensuring performance, data quality, and usability.
* Define and promote best practice standards across the team, ensuring good data quality and a reliable source of truth for the organization.
* Oversee the technical setup and maintenance of visualisation tools, ensuring optimal use of features for deployment, usability and distribution of reports and other data products.
* Guide team members in developing domain-specific datasets, within areas such as finance, HR, deal processes, fund data and operational benchmarks.
* Optimize existing data models to meet evolving business requirements and use cases.



  





**About You** 




 For this role, we are looking for someone who is organised and process-oriented with a natural ability to pay attention to detail. You have a genuine interest in data-driven decision-making and how insights can drive value across the organisation. Your strong analytical skills and solid judgment enable you to make decisions rooted in both business insights and common sense.
 



  





**Desired skills:** 



* Strong understanding of business analytics needs and the ability to translate them into technical solutions.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the versatility to adapt to diverse tasks in a dynamic environment.
* Proven experience in data modeling, business intelligence, and analytics.
* Understanding of analytics best practices and star schema design.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail, with a focus on data quality.
* Previous experience in a similar role within a business analytics environment.
* Experience with data warehousing concepts and business intelligence tools.
* Strong knowledge of SQL and other data manipulation languages.
* Minimum bachelor's degree in computer science, industrial economics, finance or business analytics.



  





**About Verdane** 




 With a focus on Digitalisation and Decarbonisation, Verdane manages close to €8 billion in assets and has invested in over 400 fast-growing businesses since 2003. Our team of over 140 professionals is based in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Helsinki, Oslo, London, Munich, and Berlin.
 



  





 We foster a down-to-earth, value-driven culture, building long-lasting relationships and enabling data-driven decisions. We are proud to have attracted high-calibre investors from over 15 countries, including foundations, endowments, pension funds, insurance companies, and family offices. More than half of the capital commitments in our recent funds come from not-for-profit investors.
 



  





 Verdane is a certified B Corporation, the most ambitious sustainability accreditation globally. We back businesses that pass our 2040 test, ensuring they can thrive in a sustainable future economy.
 



  





*Verdane is working together with Safemind as the recruitment partner, managing this process.*

title: Implementation Project Manager
description:
We are super excited to announce that Malin Jakobsson, Bert Blommestein and Graziella Guglielmo are looking to welcome their next colleague to Voyados Expert Services team, working with our product Engage.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Project Manager at Voyado, you'll play a key role in one of the most critical phases for our customers - the onboarding process. Leading the onboarding journey, you'll be supported by a team of talented specialists dedicated to crafting the best possible experience for our customers.
   

  

 You'll be part of our dynamic, cross-functional Expert Services team, working alongside around 30 colleagues where innovation meets high performance. While we enjoy spending time together at the office, we're equally excited by the opportunity to meet our customers face-to-face, gaining insights into their challenges and aspirations for a more effective CRM strategy. We engage with them through meetings, workshops, and training sessions, including Voyado Academy.
   

  

 Customer satisfaction is at the core of everything we do, and we're passionate about building lasting, professional relationships. In this role, you'll work closely with leading retailers across the Nordics and contribute to our growing success as we expand into Europe.
   

  

 Some of the things you'll be up to:
   

  

* Manage onboarding projects: Plan and run onboarding projects, including timelines, tasks, and budgets.
* Lead discovery workshops: Host workshops to understand customer needs and estimate projects, including timelines and budgets.
* Drive internal projects: Lead projects within Services and across the organization to improve processes and efficiency, mostly related to technical functionalities.
* Participate in technical discussions: Contribute to internal and external discussions to ensure successful project delivery.
* Collaborate with different roles: Work closely with Implementation Engineers, Sales, Product, Customer Success, Account Management and Support teams to align efforts and achieve goals.
* Support pre-sales and sales dialogues: Provide expertise in sales discussions to plan realistic projects and meet customer needs.


 So, who are you?
   

  

 You are a confident communicator with a background in leading projects in tech driven environments, maybe from working in SaaS, consultancy, or within digital implementation. You know how to turn customer needs into clear, actionable plans and guide stakeholders through delivery with structure, energy, and clarity.You have likely worked with technical teams or in implementation projects and you are familiar with concepts like APIs, data flows, and integrations. You know how to ask the right questions, spot potential challenges early, and connect the dots between business needs and technical solutions.Your strength lies in building trust, delivering results, and bringing a positive, solution focused energy to every project. You are solution oriented, curious by nature, and always looking for smarter ways to get things done together with your team and your clients.
   

  

**Skills & Background**
* A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience in technical project management or a related field
* Familiarity with systems and basic knowledge of SaaS
* Proficient in PowerPoint
* Excellent planning and prioritization abilities
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, written and spoken
* Experience in retail and e-commerce is a plus


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* In-house gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels -online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

*Note: As of right now we are unable to proceed with applicants outside of the EU, and a requirement of eligibility to work at Voyado is the right to work in the EU without limitations. Needless to say, this is something we are actively working on to be able to onboard colleagues from all over the world.*
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Staff Backend Engineer - Sports
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Join our dynamic team in Stockholm as a Staff Backend Engineer. In this role, you will play a crucial part in our Sportsbook domain, by working on the most impactful problems
   

  

 and being able to bring about change with effective momentum. You'll collaborate closely with our Domain Architect, participating in tech meetings, validating architectural decisions, and ensuring seamless communication flow. Additionally, you'll work collaboratively with various teams, contributing to planning, tech solutions discussions, and feature development. This role offers a unique opportunity to drive solutions, mentor team members, and actively shape our backend architecture.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Designing, developing and refactoring microservices.
* Conducting code reviews and mentoring team members.
* Interviewing and helping hire talented engineers.
* Integrating new products and building internal services to support our ecosystem.
* Taking ownership, problem-solving and collaborating with other teams.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* You have experience with common Java frameworks such as Spring and JPA
* Experience with Kotlin
* Demonstrated ability to build services from scratch.
* You’re no stranger to working with relational databases such as MySQL
* You have experience in building scalable and fault-tolerant systems and are familiar with microservice architectures


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Familiarity with additional technologies such as Akka, Hazelcast, Elasticsearch, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Consul, Google Cloud Platform, Vert.x and BigQuery.
* Experience with frontend development using JavaScript or TypeScript frameworks.


 WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Experienced SAP S/4HANA consultant - Business controlling
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a business controlling consultant you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end cost controlling and decision making processes, delivering client value in complex and innovative SAP programs for leading global organizations. This including:
   

  

* Lead the design, configuration, and implementation of SAP S/4HANA controlling modules, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.
* Provide strategic advice and expertise to clients on SAP S/4HANA controlling areas including e.g. cost accounting, product costing/variance analysis, transfer pricing, management reporting and margin analysis.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate SAP S/4HANA FICO with other SAP modules (e.g., SD, MM, PP, WM, PM) and external systems.
* Manage and mentor junior consultants, fostering their professional development and ensuring high-quality project delivery.
* Stay current with industry trends, the latest developments in SAP S/4HANA controlling, and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.


**Your Profile**
* Passionate about S/4Hana, growing people and delivering client value.
* At least 5 years of hands-on experience and proven track record in implementing SAP business controlling solutions in a complex environment.
* Strong understanding of business controlling processes and best practices with the ability to align SAP solutions with business objectives.
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment and strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Relevant SAP certification is highly desirable.
* Experience from both Greenfield and brownfield projects is a plus.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Product Quality Engineer
description:
**About FlexLink**  

FlexLink is a leading organization headquartered in Göteborg, Sweden and has operating units in 26 countries and is represented in more than 60.  

  

We are a leading provider of high-end solutions to manufacturing industries such as food, beverages, tissues, personal care, pharmaceutical, automotive, batteries and electronics.  

Our business portfolio encompasses a wide range of innovative solutions in automated production flows, with conveyor design, custom conveyor engineering, and software support to manage the information flows in a production process to match the material movement.  

Working closely with our global customers, we strive to provide state-of-the-art solutions that deliver production efficiency and enable sustainable manufacturing today and tomorrow.  

  

For more detailed information about FlexLink and its comprehensive business landscape, please visit www.flexlink.com.  

  

FlexLink is part of Coesia, a group of innovation-based industrial and packaging solutions companies operating globally, headquartered in Bologna, Italy. Coesia operates in 36 countries with 20 different companies and employs over 8,000 people as of 2023.

 **About the Role**  

The Product Quality Engineer plays a vital role in ensuring that products meet quality standards and customer expectations. This position not only safeguards the organization’s reputation but also ensures customer satisfaction and loyalty. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of technical knowledge, analytical capabilities, and strong interpersonal skills to drive quality initiatives effectively by ensuring that products consistently meet or exceed quality expectations throughout their lifecycle. This role involves collaboration with cross-functional teams to establish quality benchmarks, conducting through inspections, testing, and implementing quality assurance protocols.

 **Main activities and responsibilities**  

* Direct involvement in Initial Samples approval (by following PPAP process)
* Handling external and internal complaints as a complaint handler
* Planning and performing product audits
* Participating in PFMEA, DFMEA, Root Cause Analysis, and Part Approval Process
* Creating and updating quality procedures and instructions, including proposing new measures to correct or improve the company's final products.
* Presenting facts and data to the management team
* Support test engineers in quality related topics.
* Support project in various quality related topics.

  


**What You Need to Be Successful**


* Previous experience as a Product Quality Engineer or in a similar position
* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree (preferably in Engineering)
* Ability to use quality tools (5W2H, Ishikawa) and understand requirements from different ISO standards (ISO 9001)
* Basic skills in reading and interpreting technical drawings.
* Fluent English in both speaking and writing.
* Knowledge of SAP and Windchill is an advantage.

  

**Our Offer**  

* Collective agreement (incl. pension contribution)
* Medical insurance
* Merit increase (extra salary increase on top of the annual salary revision, based on performance)
* Wellness allowance 4000kr/year
* Parental pay
* ATK (Arbetstidsförkortning)
* Free onsite parking and great connection by train/tram/bus, etc.

  

**Join the team!**  

This is a permanent, full-time position. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Siri Taripanah at siri.taripanah@flexlink.com



Kindly note that due to GDPR we will not accept applications via mail. Please use the link to apply via our career site.
  

  

External agencies are kindly requested not to contact the company regarding this position.


*Coesia is an equal-opportunity employer and embraces diversity and inclusion.*

title: Senior C++ Engineer (Mandarin Speaker) - Stockholm / Remote from Sweden
description:
**Get to know us**
------------------



At eyeo, we transform the internet into a trusted, sustainable and accessible place where users regain control over their experience, content creators and publishers are rewarded for their content, and advertisers and consumers can connect on mutually agreed terms.



With multiple brands across the ad tech space, eyeo offers solutions for publishers, advertisers, ad-tech solutions providers and over 400 million ad-filtering users worldwide. eyeo's market-leading ad-filtering technology powers products like Adblock Plus and AdBlock as well as technical integrations for popular browsers and smartphone OEMs.



Our subsidiary, Blockthrough, is the most popular ad block recovery solution among the Comscore-150, offering premium demand via direct seats with top-tier SSPs, allowing effective content monetization and providing a platform where publishers and advertisers can efficiently transact.



We believe in creating a positive and empowering workplace where work-life balance is a priority. With a dedicated learning and development budget, you'll have the tools to grow and advance your skills, while contributing to clearly defined personal and company goals. Our people-first culture ensures you feel appreciated for your work and know that your contributions truly matter.


### **Your day-to-day activities**



The B2B Solutions team handles a number of mature and emerging solutions. Browser Ad-Filtering Solutions (BAS) is the mature product, which integrates into Chromium-based browsers and provides high performance ad-filtering on a variety of platforms. Additionally, we are developing a number of ad-filtering solutions beyond the browser for router vendors, ISPs and so on. In this versatile role you'll:


* Participate in partner communications in English and/or Chinese
* Participate in technical discussions to find efficient solutions to problems
* Contribute code in a variety of projects
* Benchmark and optimize software performance
* Work with your Engineering Lead and Product Manager to promote new features to partners and prospects and ensure that partner requests are answered and implemented, leading to higher partner satisfaction
* Explore new frontiers and create engineering opportunities that would make the product offering more attractive or lead to new product concepts

### **What you bring to the table**


* Extensive experience in modern C++
* High proficiency in Mandarin Chinese (required for communication with clients)
* Deep experience in developing, (cross-)compiling and optimizing code for (embedded) Linux
* Knowledge of the Linux networking stack and routing protocols
* Experience with continuous integration at least as a user (bonus for having set up CI pipelines)
* Working knowledge of a scripting language, e.g. Python
* High proficiency in verbal and written English
* Proactivity to solve problems with a business-oriented mindset. The work is not done as soon as the code is merged.
* The ability to break product requirements down into a project of a few months and to drive it to completion
* The ability to make decisions based on measurements and tests instead of generally considered good practices and assumptions
* The ability to work in a remote-first company, collaborating across time-zones

### **It's awesome if you have**


* Experience with AOSP (Android Open Source Platform)
* Experience of working with Linux kernel modules
* Experience in JavaScript (we are working with browsers, after all!)
* Deep interest in the browser as a product
* Understanding of the ad-tech landscape

**How and where we work**
-------------------------



eyeo is a global employer with over 300 colleagues based all over the world. We love our diversity and take great pride in our company culture. We practice an independent, remote workstyle with work distributed in cross-functional matrix teams that span predominantly EST and CET time zones. If working remotely isn't for you, we also have our HQ in Berlin and offices in Cologne, Toronto and soon in NYC that you can choose to work from. Our in-person team and company meetings foster community and collaboration. By enabling remote work and in-person sessions, we have built a culture that provides a unique dynamic of flexibility and belonging.


**What we offer**
-----------------


* Work remotely or from one of our offices —we trust you to find what works best for you
* Full package of benefits\* (health insurance, choice of hardware, paid vacation days, professional development and relocation budget, sabbatical leave, etc.)


* *Some benefits vary subject to the hiring location*


**Equal Opportunity Statement**



At eyeo, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where every employee is empowered to thrive. We believe that the diversity of our backgrounds and experiences enhances our products and services, and we take pride in being a safe space for everyone.



All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment, regardless of race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical ability, or duration of unemployment. We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and respected.


**Privacy Notice**


*When you apply, you'll be automatically forwarded to our recruitment platform operated by an external service provider called Greenhouse (seated in the US). Greenhouse collects some information on its website, such as anonymous usage statistics, by using cookies, server logs, and other similar technology. For more information, please refer to Greenhouse's Privacy Policy. All documents and information provided by you are stored with Greenhouse. In order to ensure an adequate level of data protection, eyeo and Greenhouse have entered into the EU Standard Contractual Clauses ("processors") - Commission Decision C(2010)593. You can request a copy of this by contacting us at privacy[at]eyeo.com. If you don't want your data forwarded to Greenhouse, please do not apply. For detailed and further information, please refer to our Privacy Policy at https://eyeo.com/en/privacy.*

description:

At eyeo, we transform the internet into a trusted, sustainable and accessible place where users regain control over their experience, content creators and publishers are rewarded for their content, and advertisers and consumers can connect on mutually agreed terms.



With multiple brands across the ad tech space, eyeo offers solutions for publishers, advertisers, ad-tech solutions providers and over 400 million ad-filtering users worldwide. eyeo's market-leading ad-filtering technology powers products like Adblock Plus and AdBlock as well as technical integrations for popular browsers and smartphone OEMs.



Our subsidiary, Blockthrough, is the most popular ad block recovery solution among the Comscore-150, offering premium demand via direct seats with top-tier SSPs, allowing effective content monetization and providing a platform where publishers and advertisers can efficiently transact.



We believe in creating a positive and empowering workplace where work-life balance is a priority. title: System engineer, Automotive
description:
Job Description


About the Role: In this role, you will collaborate closely with both software and hardware teams to define precise system requirements and specifications, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance.  

  

You will lead the development of cutting-edge system architecture and comprehensive design documentation for advanced embedded automotive systems. Conducting thorough system integration and validation testing will be essential to guarantee compliance with industry standards and exceed customer expectations. Identifying potential risks early in the development lifecycle and implementing effective mitigation strategies will ensure project success.  

  

You will provide expert support in troubleshooting and debugging embedded systems in both lab and field environments, ensuring reliable and robust performance. Maintaining meticulous documentation of system design, testing, and validation processes will ensure transparency and traceability.  

  

Additionally, you will actively participate in design reviews, offering valuable feedback to enhance system performance and reliability. This role will be located in Södertälje


Qualifications


Who You Are:


Experience: You bring proven experience in system engineering for embedded systems within the automotive industry. Your familiarity with automotive communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, and Ethernet ensures seamless integration and communication within vehicle systems. Additionally, your strong knowledge of embedded software development using languages like C/C++ and Python, coupled with hardware design expertise, positions you as a key contributor to innovative automotive solutions. Experience with system modeling tools like MATLAB/Simulink further enhances your ability to design and simulate complex systems. Your solid understanding of automotive safety standards, particularly ISO 26262, and functional safety principles underscores your commitment to developing safe and reliable automotive systems.


Education: You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field, providing you with a strong foundation in the principles and practices essential to system engineering and embedded systems development.


Personal Attributes: You enjoy teamwork, supporting colleagues, and sharing both struggles and successes. You prefer working on products that have a real impact and matter to customers. You thrive on solving technical challenges as they arise and appreciate a workplace where laughter is part of the culture.


We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experiences and perspectives are valuable to us.


Company Description


AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable society.


About Automotive East: The Business Unit Automotive East, located in Södertälje/Solna, operates in a truly international environment, collaborating with several sites worldwide, including Brazil, India, and Gothenburg. We support our customers with expertise in design, engineering, and embedded systems, both through in-house projects and on-site with the customer. Automotive East provides consulting services to the automotive industry and genuinely contributes to a more sustainable future by creating smarter and more sustainable vehicles.


The automotive industry is undergoing a significant transformation, with vehicles increasingly being designed and produced to become more autonomous and electrified. This shift aims to create a sustainable transport sector for the future, and Automotive East is at the heart of this exciting change.


Team Culture: At Automotive East, we believe in fostering a supportive and inclusive team culture where everyone feels valued and heard. Our teams are built on mutual respect, collaboration, and a shared passion for innovation. We encourage open communication and the sharing of ideas, knowing that diverse perspectives lead to better solutions. Our workplace is one where you can grow both professionally and personally, with opportunities for continuous learning and development. We celebrate successes together and support each other through challenges, creating a positive and enjoyable work environment. Laughter and camaraderie are integral parts of our daily work life, making Automotive East not just a place to work, but a place to thrive.

*"Why work with me?" – Mehrnoosh, Hiring Manager:*

*"As a leader, I am dedicated and communicative, always striving for my team to grow. Together, we create a supportive and stimulating environment where you can thrive. My goal is to foster a positive and fun workplace while achieving great results and satisfying our customers."*


Additional Information


We provide you with a position in a company where new idea creation is encouraged, and innovations are taken forward. Our work is demanding, but it is accompanied by freedom – freedom to develop and learn, and to combine professional and private life into a fulfilling match.


Welcome to submit your application, the deadline is 2025-05-08  

Don't forget to update suitable information for this position in your CV.


We only accept applications thrue this system. Apply by clicking the "

Our headquarters are in Stockholm, Sweden yet our businesses and clients extend right across the globe. 

Frösundaleden 2
SE 169 70, Stockholm

info@afry.com

title: Maintenance Engineer - Martin and Servera
description:
Job Introduction

We are looking for a Maintenance Engineer to join our residential maintenance team at the Martin and Servera site in Norrköping.


The TGW solution comprises a shuttle system with more than 35,000 storage locations in two temperature zones (ambient and chilled temperature). In order to utilise the available surface to its full extent, totes are stored triple-deep. An automatic mini-load warehouse with 11,000 storage locations and Mustang E+ storage and retrieval machines is used for replenishment. The site is monitored and maintained by 3 Maintenance Engineers and a Team Lead who work in a shift pattern from Monday to Friday.

* 05:00 – 14:00
* 08:00 - 17:00 ( trial Q1 2025) - regular shift: 11:00 - 20:00
* 14:00 – 23:00


The Maintenance Engineer supports our customer on all automation-related topics according to the agreed scope of supply. They provide a broad-based electrical, mechanical, controls, and software technical ability along with a right first-time mentality and a proactive approach to identifying ways to improve the site’s performance, i.e. fulfilling the contractual SLA.


Main Responsibilities
* Execute scheduled Preventive Maintenance tasks
* Resolve breakdown situations (Corrective Maintenance) - with support on more technical elements
* Ensure high levels of housekeeping, never compromise on safety first
* Support the automation to operate at its maximum efficiency
* Complete all necessary reports, including those for shift maintenance tasks, spare parts usage, and top loss, while working in DART and CMMS software platforms
* Continually improve the performance of the equipment through avenues such as top loss activities and design modifications
* Actively seek root cause when remedying any breakdowns on TGW-supplied equipment and software
* Supporting flow control activities


About You
* You have an upper secondary vocational engineering qualification
* You have some years of experience working in an automated environment
* You have an understanding of maintenance processes
* You are customer-focused
* You can work in a time-critical environment
* You are not afraid to work at heights
* You are available to work flexible shift patterns
* You are already living in the Norrköping/Linköping area
* You have an excellent command of the Swedish language


We Offer
* Permanent Contract with a competitive salary and paid overtime
* Life Assurance: 4 x Yearly Salary
* The employee is entitled to pension and social insurance benefits (sick pay and parental pay) in accordance with Swedish law and the Collective Agreement, Tekniktjänsteavtalet.
* Employee Assistance Programme
* The amount of annual vacation is 25 working days and the Employee is entitled to a vacation pay of 0,8% of the monthly gross salary per vacation day.
* Health care allowance and a free annual health check

title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with Cancer.**

  

As a **Senior Quality Assurance Engineer,** you will act as functional support representing Quality as part of project teams in design and development. With a focus on being the source of knowledge and expertise, you bring guidance and coaching/training on all aspects of Quality System Management and regulatory compliance.

  

This role includes compliance-related activities such as internal and external quality audits, nonconformance/concession/ CAPA management, training of the organization in the quality system, as well as improving and developing ways of working and QMS procedures together with other functions.

#### **What you’ll do at Elekta**

  

Would you like to be part of our driven global team, where we aim to attract and invite the best competences to Elekta? We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join our Regulatory Affairs & Quality Team at Stockholm location, which is currently a team of five team members spread globally.

  

In this exciting and diverse role, you will represent Quality on internal management meetings, projects, analysing and preparing responses on governing agency actions.

#### **Responsibilities**

* Responsible for promoting and where assigned, ensuring compliance to the quality management system and regulatory requirements.
* Represent the Quality function in decision forums, projects and processes.
* Collaborate closely and communicate effectively with other functional areas of the organization to meet business objectives ensuring regulatory compliance.
* Support processes organization as per agreed assignments
* Participate in preparation and supporting external audits by coaching others, and/or as guide and/or auditee.
* Participate in preparation and performing internal quality audits.
* Promote and maintain adherence to Elekta’s values.
* Responsible for decisions that impact safety and effectiveness of products and services for their relevant area.
#### **What you bring**

* Experience and training in regulatory affairs and/or in quality management systems and/or Engineering within a medical device environment.
* Training includes relevant medical device regulations and standards, e.g. EU MDR, QSR, ISO 13485, MDSAP, ISO 14971, IEC 62304
* A university degree in Engineering or equivalent in a related field.
* Experience from design and development and risk management, preferably including experience from projects involving medical device software.
* Strong English & Swedish written and verbal communication skills. Able to work within a multi-cultural environment. .
* Qualification and experience as lead auditor for medical device field
* High personal integrity, with an ability to interpret, adapt & provide guidance on regulations and translate into meaningful requirements to the business.
#### **Why should you join Elekta?**


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.


Overview of some of our benefits for Sweden are as below.

 **Sweden**

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays)
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme
* Private Medical Insurance
* Lunch Benefit
* Contribution to wellness activities
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week)

  



#### **Hiring process**

**We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.**

#### **Your Elekta contact**

  

  

For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Sarkar, nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com#### 

#### **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

#### **About Elekta**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.


We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: Sigma Industry Service, Student Ambassador Program 2025
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



If you as a technology student want to have a significant role in the development of a leading and growing consulting company, now is your chance to get your foot in the door of an attractive and committed employer during your studies in the role of student ambassador for Sigma Industry Services in Västerås !


**The role of ambassador and student project manager**


We are looking for one or two committed student ambassadors who from the autumn of 2025 want to be the link between Mälardalen University and Sigma Industry Services office in Västerås . As a student ambassador, you are a key person who creates creative and value-creating meetings between students and the business community, with a focus on Sigma Industry Services' opportunities and offering.


With the support of our consultants and management team, you will work to make Sigma Industry Services visible and strengthen our brand. You will have the opportunity to take advantage of and further develop the network you have established during your studies and make valuable contacts for the future.


In this role, you act as a project manager and you can flexibly adapt the work to your studies. The work effort varies, with more intense periods before and during events. With us, you will have a unique opportunity to put theory into practice, strengthen your project management skills and build a professional network that can be invaluable for your future career.


**In your role as a student ambassador, you will:**


* Be Sigma's contact person for the university's various committees at activities, events, etc.
* Plan and participate in student activities.
* Project manage and carry out own events of varying scope.
* Promote Sigma Industry in social media and physically at the university.

**What are we looking for in you?**


* You I am a student at MDU based in Västerås and have one or a few years left until graduation.
* You studying to engineer in areas such as Robotics, Reliable Systems, Computer Science, Energy Engineering, Embedded Systems, Energy Systems and Software Engineering or similar.
* You find it easy to meet new people and build relationships.

As a person, you are committed and businesslike, strive to deliver your utmost, have great social skills and are a role model in the contexts in which you work. We value that you are enterprising, independent, take ideas from planning to implementation.


**We offer**


For you, as for all our employees, we offer a fun and stimulating work environment that values both personal development and community. You will get a good insight into our consulting business and have the chance to influence the development of the company. You will have access to our office in Västerås and the opportunity to get to know our consultants. You will receive an invitation to our activities and other fun things that we do together.


Our corporate culture is characterized by entrepreneurship and short decision-making paths, where community, commitment and joy are important elements that create well-being among our employees. For a future employee at Sigma Industry Services there are no obstacles, only opportunities.


Welcome to a personal company where we influence our future together!


**Application**


In your cover letter, we want you to describe why you want to become a student ambassador at Sigma and why you are the one we are looking for. Also formulate three suggestions for activities/events or something else that is in line with the assignment as described above.


The plan is for the service to start during the autumn semester 2025. **We look forward to hearing from you!**

### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Mikael Hagström,  

+46 706012715  

mikael.hagstrom@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Sigma Industry Service, Student Ambassador Program 2025
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Services
* #### **LOCATION**


Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Geotechnical Engineering, Structural Engineering, Road and Landscape Architecture and Design, Environmental Consulting, Rail Design and Engineering, Water and Wastewater Engineering, Road Design and Traffic Planning, Calculation & Simulation, Industrial Design & Ergonomics, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing engineering incl. Logistics, Electricity & Automation, Energy & Power Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Project Management & Management, Life Science, QA & Validation, PLM, Audio/Acoustics, Opto engineering, Project Management, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, RF And Microwave, Function development, System design, Business Intelligence, Business Systems, System development, Operation, support and infrastructure, Test & Quality, Business Analysis, Digital Communication, Requirement Management & Business Development, Other, Project Management, Software, Client Tools & Skills, Generic, Field of Experience, Role Experience, Product, Product Information, Software development, Digitalisation, Digitalisation, Automation, Administration, Finance, HR, Management, Sales and Marketing, Sustainability
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-04-08
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-04-18
* #### **CONTACT**


Mikael Hagström, mikael.hagstrom@sigma.se, +46706012715
