title: Senior Engineer - Tech Lead / Tech Director
description:
### **Why Dashy?**


We believe in creating **meaningful and memorable digital experiences** that leave lasting impressions. As a consultant at Dashy, you will have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, spanning **games, music, and interactive media**. We strive to partner with clients who create products and services that they—and we—can be truly proud of.


At Dashy, **our people are always at the center**—together, we build and grow the company with **happiness as our guiding principle**. We foster an environment where personal development thrives, collaboration is key, and knowledge-sharing is embedded in everything we do.

### **Your Role**


As a **Senior Technology Consultant**, you’ll operate at the intersection of **technology, leadership, and digital entertainment**, helping our clients build exceptional products while also shaping Dashy as a company. This means:

* **Providing technical leadership** to teams across all stages of development, from early prototyping to full-scale production and live operations.
  
* **Shaping technical strategy and architecture**, ensuring solutions are scalable, maintainable, and aligned with client goals.
  
* **Driving engineering best practices**, including code quality, tooling, CI/CD pipelines, and performance optimization.
  
* **Growing and mentoring teams**, fostering a culture of accountability, innovation, and continuous learning.
  
* **Balancing multiple responsibilities**, delivering high-impact work at our clients while also contributing to Dashy’s growth.
  
* **Engaging with stakeholders at all levels**, from hands-on engineers to business executives, bridging technical and strategic discussions.

### **What We’re Looking For**


We’re seeking an experienced and adaptable technology leader with a strong consulting mindset. You likely have:

* **8+ years of experience in software engineering**, with a focus on game or interactive media technologies.
  
* **3+ years in a leadership role (Tech Lead, Tech Director, or similar),** with hands-on experience guiding engineering teams, driving technical strategies, and ensuring timely delivery.
  
* **A strong technical foundation**, with expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks.
  
* **Proven experience across the full development lifecycle**, from prototyping to production, shipping and live operations of digital products, ideally in games or interactive experiences.
  
* **Deep understanding of backend and client-side development**, including networking, performance optimization, and scalable architecture.
  
* **Experience mentoring and growing engineering teams**, fostering a high-performance culture.
  
* **A passion for digital entertainment**, aligning with our mission to create experiences that matter.

  

### **Join us!**



At Dashy, we’re not just building a company—we’re building a community of passionate individuals who want to make an impact. This role is an opportunity to be part of something meaningful: shaping the future of **technology in digital entertainment**, growing an ambitious consulting firm, and working with some of the most exciting projects in the industry.



Are you ready to bring your expertise, leadership, and creativity to Dashy? Let’s talk!

title: Pre-Commissioning Engineer
description:
**Job Overview:**

The Pre-Commissioning Engineer **r** eports to the Pre-commissioning Manager and assist planning and execution of safe and efficient pre-commissioning activities to achieve Mechanical Completion in the Cold Mill and Hot Mill. Support the Client for the Commissioning, Start-up, and Performance Testing of the facility to achieve the production and performance objectives and contractual objectives. Work collaboratively within the Project team and with Client to maintain positive relationships. Participates in the development of pre-commissioning home office deliverables for the project. Participates in the development of systemization and system boundary mark-ups. Participates in engineering design reviews as assigned by the Pre-Commissioning Manager including HAZOP, P&ID’s, SIL and Model reviews. Participates in the development of activity schedules for pre-commissioning, commissioning and start-up.


The project is in the Green Steel Market and the position may commence in The Hague office before transferring to Site at Boden, Sweden.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Participates in the development of pre-commissioning, procedures
* Participates in the development of spares, subcontracts, consumables, temporary equipment and vendor services
* Interfaces heavily with the completions team, construction and Client personnel regarding all aspects of site inspections and testing for pre-commissioning, commissioning and start-up activities
* Supervises the assigned pre-commissioning team personnel, subcontractors and Client personnel in the execution of pre-commissioning activities in a safe, efficient and successful manner
* Works closely with the Construction group for installation completion inspections and accepting the completed works as deemed ready for pre-commissioning.
* Participates in the Completion walkdowns, punch-list development and clearing of punch-list items by the Construction group or the subcontractor
* Provides input to the “lesson learned” database
* Provides input to the Close Out Report at the completion of the project

  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* 5+ yrs in oil and gas with major contractor or consultant
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering
* Preferably possess a degree or diploma or equivalent in engineering
* Have a minimum of 5 years’ commissioning experience in the oil & gas, chemical process, or steel industry
* Familiarization with the steel manufacturing process and equipment would be an advantage
* Able to effectively communicate technical solutions and concepts to other engineers and non-engineers
* Must have good computer software skills in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio
* Must have good organizational skills and be adaptable to the needs of various discipline groups
* Must have the ability to assess and communicate project requirements and expectations in a clearly defined, positive and productive manner
* Proficiency in English, Multi-Language skills a plus
* Valid Driver’s License for Site in Sweden
* Requires in-depth understanding of concepts, principles and practices in commissioning, completions and training as well as basic knowledge of other functions, such as construction and operations & maintenance.
* Applies understanding of the industry to improve effectiveness

#LI-OO1

title: Gameplay Engineer
description:
As a Gameplay Engineer, you will join a small team and collaborate closely with some of the most talented developers in the industry to craft something truly special.
   

  

 We believe that great games are made in creative environments where builds are always playable and teams can move fast and test as many ideas as possible. We iterate quickly and encourage experimentation. You will work in close collaboration with our designers and to create the systems and tools we need to realize that environment.
   

  

 The games we're making are built in Unreal Engine with C++ and Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Work with designers and engineers to bring innovative gameplay ideas to life
* Prototype, iterate, and help shape the gameplay experience
* Take a "gameplay-first" approach, ensuring technical decisions enhance the player experience


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A good grasp of what good gameplay looks and feels like
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft
* A problem-solving mindset and willingness to work in an iterative, fast-moving environment
* Fluent in English - our team comes from all over the world!


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Experience working on multiplayer games or shooters
* Experience working with Unreal Engine
* Ability to speak "design"
* A deep passion for games with significant hands-on experience as a player
* The ability to draw from personal gameplay experiences when developing


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer - Hybrid - Stockholm
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
*RaySearch develops innovative software solutions to improve cancer care. About 1000 clinics in more than 40 countries use RaySearch software to improve treatments and quality of life for patients. RaySearch was founded in 2000 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. The headquarters is located in Stockholm, with subsidiaries in the US, Europe, Asia and Australia & New Zealand. Today we are more than 400 employees with a common vision of improving cancer care with innovative software. Our great staff is crucial for our success and we offer a fantastic working environment in modern offices, flexibility and good opportunities for development. We believe in equal opportunities, value diversity and work actively to prevent discrimination.*
 RaySearch is at the forefront of cancer treatment technology, and we are now looking for a skilled frontend engineer to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to shape the frontend experience of RayIntelligence, our analytics tool for radiotherapy that aggregates data from various systems and machines, empowering clinics to draw valuable insights from a population of treated patients.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As the first frontend engineer in our team, you will play a key role in designing and implementing modern user interfaces that visualize large and complex datasets. RayIntelligence is still in its early stages, giving you the chance to influence both design decisions and the overall frontend architecture.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop modern web applications with Apache Superset at the core.
* Build dynamic, high-quality Apache ECharts visualizations, using React/TypeScript (JavaScript)/CSS.
* Collaborate closely with data engineers and domain experts in radiotherapy to ensure an optimal user experience.
* Learn about the radiotherapy domain to tailor solutions for clinics’ needs.


**Your Profile**
 We are looking for a frontend engineer with a strong sense of ownership and an interest for creating intuitive and visually compelling user interfaces. You should be comfortable working in a data-heavy environment and be eager to expand your technical expertise.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience developing modern web applications.
* Ability to take ownership of long and short term assignments, and deliver high-quality solutions.
* UI and graphic design sensibilities.
* Technical expertise in frontend engineering, including optimizing performance and architecting scalable solutions
* Solid understanding of general software engineering best practices, including:


 - Version control & code reviews - Unit & end-to-end testing, automated testing in CI/CD - Writing clean, reusable, and scalable code - Documentation
   

  

**Meriting**
* Experience with advanced data visualization tools such as D3.js, THREE.js, or WebGL.
* Python


**Our Culture**
 At RaySearch, we share a passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our team consists of dedicated experts who strive to deliver exceptional results through collaboration, attention to detail, and cutting-edge technology. We take pride in our role as a leader in cancer treatment, developing solutions that truly make a difference for patients worldwide.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment in Hagastaden, Stockholm’s Life Science Hub. Our modern office space includes an in-house gym, yoga classes, and social activities such as ping pong, table football, and after-work events. We also provide a fantastic lunch buffet, daily fika, and a stunning rooftop terrace with a 360-degree view of Stockholm. This comes with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply for the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications via e-mail.

title: Internship in System Development
description:
**Position Summary**
 As an intern in the System Development department, you will get to work in close collaboration with experienced developers on a project where you will apply problem solving, programming and designer skills to help us with one of the following projects:
   

  

* Design and implement centralized logging and monitoring solutions for systems and microservices, creating dashboards and alerts using tools like Grafana.
* Develop and maintain ETL pipelines using tools like Apache Airflow to efficiently move and make data accessible on our data platform.
* Explore automation techniques for generating UI and simple web interfaces to effectively display and interact with data.


 You will be assigned a mentor to guide you through the internship. The internship will start in the beginning of August, with four weeks of full-time work at our centrally located Stockholm office. The internship will then continue part-time during the semester for an additional 8-9 weeks, with the possibility of additional part-time work after completion.
   

  

**Who We Look For**
 Are you pursuing studies in computer science or engineering and curious about financial markets? Do you have fundamental knowledge in software development? Perhaps experience from frontend/backend development using Python, Java, or C#. Fluency in English or Swedish is required. If you are driven by intellectual curiosity and want to learn, explore, and challenge yourself, chances are that we would be a great match.
   

  

 Interested? We’d love to hear from you! Apply before April 27th with your CV and cover letter.
   

  

 Lynx Asset Management was founded in Stockholm in 1999. Our goal is to provide clients with high risk-adjusted returns using systematic investment strategies, developed through scientific methods utilizing data, analysis and technology.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer at Fortum, you will join an innovative early-stage venture and contribute to a clean energy future. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovations in sustainable energy. You will work on cutting-edge projects, utilizing advanced analytics to solve complex problems and optimize energy solutions. Your work will directly impact our mission to create a cleaner world, and you will play a key role in shaping the future of energy. Join us and be part of something bigger.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Fortum, we value creativity, collaboration, and the power of data-driven decision-making. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a supportive environment, with access to the latest tools and technologies.
   

  

 We offer competitive compensation packages, professional growth opportunities, and the satisfaction of knowing your efforts are contributing to a sustainable future for generations to come. If you are ready to make a difference and embrace the challenge of transforming the energy landscape, Fortum is the place for you.
   

  

 Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team to play a key role in our digitalization and AI journey. You'll help develop Hiven, our market-leading demand response solution.
   

  

 Main responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
   

  

  

* Extract value from high-resolution data for ML & optimization pipelines
* Design and automate a stable MLOps pipeline with model re-training
* Develop scalable forecasting and steering models
* Implement aggregation methods for scalability
* Create tractable approximations when needed
* Collaborate with backend, frontend, DevOps, CloudOps, EA architecture, and cybersecurity teams on interfaces, storage, and data protocols
* Support data and control engineers
* Coach the team and learn about the energy domain


 The positions can be based in either Solna, Sweden or Espoo, Finland.
   

  

**About You**
 To thrive in this role, you should have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. A strong background in Machine Learning and MLOps is essential, with at least three years of solid experience in software engineering using Python. You must also be proficient in statistics and data science, having spent a minimum of two years honing these skills. Experience working with cloud solutions, particularly AWS, for over two years is necessary.
   

  

  

* Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers, and DevOps practices.
* Knowledge of Software Engineering principles: SOLID, clean code.
* Excellent communication skills and a willingness to learn about the energy domain.
* Full professional proficiency in written and oral English.


 Preferred additional experience includes:
   

  

  

* Stochastic optimization and control.
* Understanding of electricity markets and flexibility markets.
* Knowledge of chargers for electric vehicles or home energy management.
* Experience with forecast models and parameter tuning.
* Data engineering, architecture development, and deployment.
* IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance, and support.
* Data storage and maintenance methods.
* Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.
* Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IoT devices.
* Experience working in an Agile environment.


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Please submit your application by 2025-04-21 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com. For questions about Hiven, please contact Jani Leirimaa, CEO and founder of Hiven Energy, jani@hiven.energy.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.
   

  

**We are Fortum and Hiven**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonize their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
   

  

 For us working with start-ups and innovation means faster renewal and keeping up to date with the latest technologies. We want to be right at the forefront of innovation, dreaming up a better tomorrow. Therefore, Fortum invests time and resources in supporting innovation and start-ups, both internally and externally.
   

  

 Hiven is one of Fortum’s digital ventures for a cleaner future. Hiven is an innovative new service for companies wanting to deliver greener and smarter services to their customers. Hiven’s products include services such as smart charging with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to electric vehicles and electric vehicle chargers – and smart heating with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to heating appliances. All these devices are connected to Hiven to be steered in a smarter way.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Google Meet
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
* 3 years of experience with Machine Learning (ML) infrastructure (e.g., model deployment, model evaluation, optimization, data processing, debugging).
* 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
* Experience in developing software systems in modern C++.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience in Audio processing/Echo cancellation/or Video streaming.
* Knowledge of coding with Python.


**About the job** 
 Google Cloud's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google Cloud's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. You will anticipate our customer needs and be empowered to act like an owner, take action and innovate. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build a complete understanding of perceived video quality and identify opportunities for the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) to augment it.
* Develop ML models and the application of AI for video quality enhancements.
* Collaborate with cross-functional Meet Media teams (and external partners) for the integration of video processing solutions into production.
* Leverage AI/ML technologies to enhance the video experience for millions of Meet users.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Customer Engineer, Applied AI (English, Swedish)
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience building integrations using one of more of the following languages: Python, Node.js, Go, or Java.
* 10 years of experience building conversational applications and contact center applications.
* Ability to travel up to 50% of the time, as required.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish for this client-facing role.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience with modern cloud architectures and technologies.
* Experience in building reusable assets like demos and high level architecture as part of training and enablement programs.
* Experience in responding to RFI/RFP.
* Experience with contact center technologies and platforms (e.g., Avaya, Genesys, Cisco, Mitel, Twilio, Liveperson, etc.) or Cloud Contact Center solutions.


**About The Job**
 The Customer Engagement Suite with Google Applied AI delights customers with an end-to-end application that combines our most advanced conversational AI, with multi-modal and omnichannel functionality to deliver exceptional customer experiences at every touch-point.
   

  

 As an EMEA Applied AI Customer Engineer, you will be responsible for growing the adoption of Customer Engagement in EMEA by virtue of your experience in building conversational applications. You will form part of a central and highly specialized technical team that engages directly with customers and partners with the focus to accelerate the usage of Conversational AI solutions on Google Cloud Platform. You will work with cross-functional peers to support selected enterprise customers in their adoption journey. You will grow the ecosystem of partners by running technical workshops and training. You will run demonstrations and small proofs of concept with customers and provide feedback to Global Product Leads and Product Management.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conduct technical pre-business activity in establishing technical viability and fit for the customers with the Applied AI suite (e.g., Including Conversational Agents, Agent Assist, Conversational Insights and Google Contact Center AI Platform (CCaaS), etc.).
* Build and nurture a community of AI partners and practitioners for Applied AI across EMEA.
* Reflect the feedback of EMEA customers, partners, and the field to influence product direction.
* Partner closely with Customer Engineering leaders, Product leaders, business strategy, Developer Advocates and executive leadership to execute the Applied strategy.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Erfaren Java-utvecklare till team ETA, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Vill du utveckla tjänster som når hundratusentals kunder i Norden varje dag? Vi är ett engagerat team med stor teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet, som drivs av att leverera värde till våra kunder och vår affär. Vi söker nu fler erfarna utvecklare som vill bli en del av oss.
   

  

 Bli en del av Team ETA
   

  

* Vi tillhandahåller tjänster med påverkan på hundratusentals kunder och mottagare i Norden varje dag.
* Vi utvecklar mikrotjänster i Kubernetes och kodar i Java.
* Vi har vår infrastruktur i AWS.
* Vi har höga krav på kvalitet och robusthet på våra leveranser, då det har direkt påverkan på våra kunder.
* Vi äger våra tjänster, i vått och torrt, och har helhetsansvaret för det vi bygger – från design, utveckling, testning och användarupplevelse till övervakning, larm och affärsmetrik.
* Vi driftsätter flera gånger i veckan och kan se värdet av det vi gör direkt.
* Vi ansvarar själva för att vårt sätt att arbeta är det bästa för vår leverans och för oss.


 Vem är du?
   

  

* Du är en erfaren java-utvecklare, med minst fem års erfarenhet, som drivs av att skapa värde och trivs med att jobba i team i en agil miljö.
* Du vill jobba med backend och är intresserad av användarupplevelsen.
* Du tar ägarskap i det du levererar hela vägen till kund.
* Du gillar att konkret förenkla vardagen för konsumenter, kunder och kollegor.
* Du talar och skriver bra svenska och engelska.
* Java 21, Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, CI/CD-pipelines, AWS, Prometheus, Grafana
* REST-tjänster och säkerhet
* Utveckling av distribuerade system där både datamängd, prestanda och tillgänglighet är en stor del av utmaningen
* Utveckling av meddelandedrivna tjänster
* Infrastructure-as-code, till exempel AWS CloudFormation
* Testdriven utveckling
* Akademisk utbildning; gärna systemvetenskap, datavetenskap eller motsvarande erfarenhet


 Vi erbjuder dig
   

  

* Att vara en del av ett trevligt och stöttande team.
* Bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
* Att arbeta med vår moderna teknikstack med möjlighet att vara med och påverka.
* Utveckla dina tekniska färdigheter. Som ett exempel sponsrar vi dig för att bli AWS-certifierad.
* Ett jobb där värdet du levererar är viktigt för hundratusentals kunder och användare.
* Goda försäkrings- och tjänstepensionsvillkor.
* Friskvårdsbidrag och tillgång till kontoret Arkens gym och pool.
* Personalförmåner genom PostNords egen personalstiftelse PostNord Plus.


 Vi gör vardagen enklare
   

  

 PostNord är den ledande leverantören av kommunikations- och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Vi säkerställer postservicen till privatpersoner och företag i Sverige och Danmark. Vi strävar efter att göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är ansvarstagande, modiga och engagerade, och leder effektivt förändring oavsett om vi leder oss själva eller andra.
   

  

 Vi uppmuntrar lagarbete, uppriktighet och positiva relationer på arbetsplatsen. Vi bygger vidare på våra framgångar och lär oss av både kollegor och misstag. Människor med olika bakgrund arbetar hos oss. Du kommer därför vara en del av en arbetsplats med stor mångfald, vilket bidrar till bättre resultat för verksamheten. Besök oss på postnord.com.
   

  

 Ansök
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan. Urval sker löpande så ansök så snart som möjligt. Om du undrar något avseende tjänsten, maila allan.dahl@postnord.com. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 För fackliga kontaktpersoner se Facklig kontakt | PostNord.

title: Quality Assurance Tester
description:
*Var med på resan att bli Europas ledande och mest hållbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor!* 




  





**Om Agria** 




 Agria är ett av Europas största djurförsäkringsbolag. De växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike och Irland. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vård Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning. Hos Agria är målet är att tillsammans skapa en arbetsmiljö där alla trivs, har roligt, växer och mår bra. Här strävar de alltid efter att erbjuda en plats som främjar kontinuerligt lärande.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Hos Agria blir du en del av gruppen Kompetenscenter. Här hittar du skickliga utvecklare inom olika tekniker, produktägare, affärsanalytiker, kravledare, QA-testare och Scrum Masters. I rollen som testare kommer du att arbeta i en agil och tvärfunktionell miljö där testning är en central del av utvecklingsprocessen. Som QA-testare hos Agria får du en viktig roll i att säkerställa kvalitet och funktionalitet genom hela utvecklingscykeln, samtidigt som du blir en del av Career Accelerator Program. Läs mer om Career Accelerator Program här.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Skapa testplaner och testfall i Azure
* Utföra manuell testning
* Genomföra regressionstester
* Stort fokus på att identifiera möjligheter till automatisering eller förbättra befintlig automatisering
* Löpande planera inom QA-teamet för att identifiera behov och testa i de initiativ eller team med högst prioritet



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att lyckas i denna roll tror vi att du har:
 


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom test, IT eller motsvarande
* 1-2 års erfarenhet av liknande roll
* Erfarenhet av manuell testning
* Tekniskt intresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom testautomatisering
* Erfarenhet av Selenium, Playwright eller liknande
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



 Det är meriterande om du:
 


* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering
* Har erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla testpipelines.
* Kunskap om SAFE-ramverket och agila arbetsmetoder.
* Tidigare programmeringserfarenhet.
* ISTQB-certifiering eller annan relevant certifiering.



 Som person är du:
 


* Initiativtagande och orädd, trivs med att arbeta i olika team och projekt.
* Problemlösande och analytisk, med en förmåga att tänka strategiskt kring testning.
* Nyfiken och kunskapsdelande, gillar att inspirera och stötta kollegor.



  





**Vad Career Accelerator Programmet erbjuder:** 



* Utbildning en gång per månad inom olika område
* Utbildning inom bland annat testautomatisering
* Utbildning inom personlig utveckling så som självledarskap och kommunikation
* Individuell karriärscoaching
* Sociala event så som AWs tillsammans med andra deltagare i Career Accelerator Program



  





**Vad Agria erbjuder:** 



* En unik möjlighet att vara en del av en internationell organisation som är i en expansiv fas
* Vara en del av kompetenta och prestigelösa team där du får stor möjlighet att påverka
* En flexibel arbetsmiljö som hjälper dig att balansera arbete och vardag på bästa sätt
* Mentorskap och stöd från erfarna kollegor för att utveckla dina tester och tekniska färdigheter
* Möjlighet vid intresse att arbeta med AI och att få utnyttja nya teknologier för att effektivisera testarbetet



  





**Övrig information:** 




**Plats:** 
 Stockholm, hybrid
 



**Start:** 
 September 2025
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Anställningsform:** 
 Detta är en konsultlösning med en anställning hos A-hub med möjlighet för en fastanställning hos Agria efter 12 månader.
